Fridah, aged 30, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children, who are both in school. Fridah has been in farming for three years, producing milk and vegetables, which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase animal feed in order to increase her animals' milk production, thus producing more income, which will help her pay for her children's school fees and better her standard of living. Poor climatic changes is Fridah's main challenge in farming.

Fridah believes that Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro finance organization for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина уже 17 лет торгует мужской одеждой на выездных рынках города Мелитополя. Она хорошо знает данную группу товара, разбирается в брендах и качестве своей продукции.  
Нина обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно пуловеры, свитера и т.д. для последующей реализации со своей торговой точки.
texts.en:
Nina has been selling men's clothing at traveling markets in Melitopol. She knows this type of merchandise well, and is very familiar with the brands and the quality of their products.

Nina has turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 4,000 hrivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise, especially pullovers, sweaters, etc. for the next sale at her retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise, specially pullovers, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with four children. Fe is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fe is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase a hog. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her living conditions due her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hog

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 50-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area where she wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy children's and women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 53 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Jesusa is married without children. 

Jesusa has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for seven years. Jesusa requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. 
 
Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to save money in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents for her store

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce’s Group is made up of two ladies who are aged between 33 to 37 years. They both sell provisions and have been living in the same neighborhood for four years.

Joyce is a 33-year-old provisions seller who is single but has one daughter. Her daughter is 12 years old and is a junior high school student. They live together in a family house. Joyce operates her business at her residence, on the pavement. She sells between 7:30 am to 9:00 pm. This is her third loan with ID Ghana and she is requesting 900 Ghana cedis to buy more Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees, milk, and diapers.

Joyce and Patience (her group member) need an amount of GHS 1,700 to be able to buy more goods for their respective businesses. In 10 years' working experience, Joyce has not come across a good and flexible loan facility like that of ID Ghana’s.

She therefore wishes to build her own house in the near future out of this loan system and she is counting on Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to buy more Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees, milk, and diapers to sell

loans.name: Ruth Chan

texts.en:
Ruth Chan is married woman who has three children. She is 32 years old, and lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig.  

Ruth Chan raises rice for sale, and she's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns PHP 11,000 doing this type of work.

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. In 2010, Ruth Chan joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Ruth Chan wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth, aged 34, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children, who are both in school. Kenneth has been in farming for five years producing milk, fruits, and vegetables, which he supplies to a board. He also does welding as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase materials to construct a zero grazing unit, which will help him feed his animals and improve their milk production. This will help him pay for his children's educations and better his standard of living. He plans to start selling cereals in the near future as an additional source of income. Drought and the high cost of farm inputs are his main challenges.

Kenneth says Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro finance institution for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolor-Erdene is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented apartment in the northern province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver for the state railway station. Her daughter is six years old and goes to the secondary school, while her son is three years old and goes to the kindergarten. 

Mrs. Bolor-Erdene has worked as an assistant for a trade business of her friend's since 2006. Now she is starting to run her own trading business. She imports retail goods from China and sells to a small Russian town closer to the border. She requests a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more seasonal products in order to increase her profits and expand her business further. Her next goal is to build her own house. 

She is an open-minded and welcoming person.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal products to increase her profits in her trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water tanks and pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Esther will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and animal feed.

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to expand the farming business by buying another farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and animal feed

loans.name: Jollonar

texts.en: Jollonar is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba in Jordan. She has five children and requested a 400 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her own home. In the future, she would like to expand her business and specify a room for it. She also wants to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her home

loans.name: Precillana

texts.en: Precillana is from Kapalaran, Tambulig. She is 57 years old. Precillana is married and has 4 children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Precillana joined GDMPC. Precillana is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her rice farming business

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido ya cogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros. _luis en un joven muy trabajador, pero cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de barrio, pero lo que más le gusta es comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “ceviche Mixto”.  Debidos a motivos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas. 

Cada día Luis trabaja como mecánico, en una empresa de su ciudad, el realiza mantenimiento a la maquinaria pesada y por ello labora alrededor de 10 horas al dia; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene ganas de salir adelante.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar cemento, arena, pintura, entre otros materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, con lo cual podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Luis is 21 and lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is characterized by its very warm climate. Although it is very dusty, it is an agricultural city. In particular, the residents cultivate corn and cotton, among other crops. Luis is a very hard-working young man, but when he has free time he greatly enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbours. His greatest pleasure is eating his favourite food, the rich "ceviche mixto". Due to economic factors, he was only able to stay in school until the fifth grade of secondary school. He would have liked to study business administration.
Every day, Luis works as a mechanic in a company in the city. He does heavy machinery maintenance and works about ten hours per day. He thinks that things are going well for him at work because he is very responsible and, above all, because he has a desire to succeed.
Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy cement, sand, paint, and other materials for making improvements to his home. This will allow him to provide his parents with a better quality of life and to continue working hard every day to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have my own home and to have a large business."

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Hellen Ibeth

texts.es:
Hellen tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Helllen es una joven muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte, especialmente le encanta jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, pero lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Caucau de Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo ha podido estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía, ya que le encanta cocinar.

Día a día Hellen trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día; ella  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón.

Hellen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar 2 mesas, sillas, pintado de local, entre otros, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor atención a los clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Hellen is 21 and lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is a city with a very warm, welcoming climate. It is an agricultural area where cotton and corn are cultivated, among other crops. Hellen is a very hard-working young woman, but when she has free time she greatly enjoys playing sports. She especially loves playing volleyball with her friends and neighbours. However, her favourite thing to do is to enjoy her favourite food, the rich "caucau de pollo". Because of her lack of economic resources, she was only able to stay in school up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study gastronomy, since she loves cooking.
Every day, Hellen works in her food sales business. She works approximately ten hours per day and is able to serve up to 25 customers in one day. She thinks that things are going well for her in her business because she is very kind to her customers, and, above all, because her food is delicious.
Hellen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy chairs, two tables, and paint her business, among other things. This way, she will be able to provide a better customer service and improve her income. She will be able to continue to work toward realizing her greatest dream: "To have a large restaurant".

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and to paint her business, among other items.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Bethlehem Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO BETHLEHEM
Este grupo está formado la líder del grupo Marta Alicia Vargas quien en su casa  tiene una pequeña tienda que le ayuda para seguir apoyando a su familia como actividad secundaria tiene la venta de leña,  el anhelo de ella es poder darle educación a sus hijos ya que están grandes y una va a empezar los estudios  básicos entonces necesita un poco mas de dinero y lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para los gastos entonces solicita el crédito para poder surtir su tienda de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y comprar más leña ya que por mayor se lo dan un poco más barato  y su ganancia es mayor,  espera que puedan apoyarla para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Bethlehem Solidarity Group
The leader of this group is Marta Alicia Vargas, who has a small store in her home that allows her to continue to support her family. As a secondary activity, she sells firewood. Her desire is to provide her children with an education, since they are older and one is about to start her basic education. Because of this, Marta needs a bit more money since her husband's income is not sufficient for their costs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to stock her store with basic food staples, and to buy more firewood; buying wholesale is cheaper and her earnings will be higher. She hopes that you will be able to support her in getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic staples and firewood.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 60 years old and lives in Dolores,Clarin. Efren is married with 4 children. 

Efren has a store that sells dried fish in the community. Efren has had this business for 2 years, and has requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Efren has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Efren hopes to improve his general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.en:
Edilma is 64 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela. She is widowed and has 6 children. 

Edilma works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Edilma has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Edilma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Edilma hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is from the village of Gauyabal. He is 53 years old. He is married to Elisa. Jose is engaged in the transportation business, using his motorcycle. He has been engaged in this business for many years. He usually receives an income of PHP 300 per day. Jose is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. Jose still hopes to find ways to provide for his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Monica Celia

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 24 años tiene un bebe, ella se dedica a la fabricación  y venta de payasas (colchones de paja) este oficio lo aprendió de su madre y su hermana que se dedican a esta actividad hace ya varios años, ellas realizan su trabajo en su mismo domicilio  que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Kalajahuira, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Mónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra de paja y yute al por mayor para disminuir sus costos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de este material necesario para realizar su trabajo,  la señora es cliente del grupo Kalajahuira el cual es muy bueno y paga puntualmente, se le otorgo este crédito debido a que ella es muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos, la Sra. Mónica  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que en la zona en la que vive, muchos clientes se dedican a a la venta de colchones, y ella es pequeña productora, no cuenta con mucho capital para su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material como paja y yute al por mayor, su deseo  es el de  mejorar sus ingresos para poder conseguir sus propios bienes como muebles enseres y también su propio taller ya que actualmente utiliza el de su hermana.
texts.en: Señora Mónica is 24 and has a baby.  She makes a living by making and selling "payasas" (straw mattresses).  She learned how to do this from her mother and sister, who have done this work for several years.  They do their work in the same location, which is located in Kalajahuira.  This loan is her first with the institution.  She will use it to buy straw and jute wholesale to decrease her costs.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of cash to buy this material that she needs for her wrok.  She is a client of the Kalajahuira group, which is very good and makes its payments on time.  She was offered this credit because she is very responsible and punctual with her payments.  Mónica faces challenges with her business.  In the area where she lives, many people sell these mattresses.  Since she is a small producer, she doesn't have a lot of capital for her business.  She will use these benefits to keep buying materials like straw and jute wholesale.  Her dream is to improve her income to be able to obtain her own goods like furniture.  She also wants her own shop since she currently uses her sister's.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of straw and jute wholesale to decrease her costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooker and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 22-year-old farmer from Nkubu County in Kenya. She is single with only one child. She has been farming for two years producing fruits and milk which she sells to the people around her locality. Drought, pests and diseases are some of her major challenges.

Betty is requesting a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats that will help increase her income; thus, uplifting her standard of living. She will also be able to educate her child. She looks forward to opening a cereal shop in the near future as an additional source of income. Betty says Juhudi Kilimo has very affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Solidario El Éxito Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO EL ÉXITO
INTEGRADO POR IRMA LETICIA, ELLA ACTUALMENTE ES PROPIETARIA DE UN PREDIO DONDE SIEMBRA MILPA (MAIZ) ES UNA PERSONA MUY EMPRENDEDORA LA CUAL HA LUCHADO JUNTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSO PARA PODER TENER LO Q HASTA EL DIA DE HOY HAN LOGRADO ELLA TIENE UN SUEÑO GRANDE QUE ES PODER SEMBRAR MUCHO MÁS QUE LO QUE SIEMPRA ASTA AHORA PARA PODER AYUDAR A SUS HIJOS Y PODER CONTRIBUIR CON SU ESPOSO ELLA TIENE 4 HIJOS A LOS CUALES TIENE ESTUDIANDO ELLA NO SOLO DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE QUEDEN DONDE ESTAN SI NO QUE SE CONVIERTAN EN UNIVERSITARIOS PERO PARA ELLO, ESTA CONSIENTE QUE DEBE APOYAR MUY FUERTEMETE A SU ESPOSO POR LO QUE EN ESTA OCASIÓN TOCA  LAS PUERTAS DE KIVA PARA PODER ADQUIRIR UN PRESTAMO DE ANTEMAMO ESTA AGRADECIDA YA QUE ESTO LE AYUDARA A SALIR ADELANTE.ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS Y ABONO PARA EL CULTIVO.
texts.en: Irma Leticia is a member of the group, "Solidario el Éxito."  She owns a piece of land where she grows corn.  She is a very enterprising person, and she has fought along with her husband to be able to have what they do today.  Her big dream is to be able to plant a lot more than what she always has to be able to help her children and to contribute to their family's income with her husband.  She has four children, who are in school.  She hopes that they keep studying and go to college.  To do that, she knows that she has to support her husband very much.  This is why she is knocking on Kiva's door to obtain a loan.  She is grateful in advance since it will help her get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure to grow corn.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a married man and he has four children. His oldest child is twenty nine years old. He is 57 years old and has been in the sari-sari store business for thirty years. Fidel sells merchandise like canned goods, detergents, soaps, and toiletries. Aside from the sari-sari store, he also sells tuba- a red wine made from coconut. 

Fidel has request a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise, to buy fertilizer for  bananas, and to buy tungog-a tanbark extract from mangrove species (an ingredient contributing to the nice color of the tuba). In the future, Fidel hopes to expand his business in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as soaps, detergents, canned goods and toiletries; to buy fertilizers for the banana, and tungog for making tuba (coconut wine).

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a 31 year old  man, married with one son. He grows fruits and vegetables in his garden, something he has been doing for the last 8 years. He is very experienced, as a farmer, and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it.  He was not able to finda  job for several years and decided to start his own business.  

Yashar usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable prices in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes is Dolma, a dish made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 350 AZN. Yashar`s wife is working as school teacher and also helps her husband.

Now Yashar would like to invest more capital into his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he has applied for 1200 AZN. This is only one source of income for his family and he hopes that this loan will improve the quality of life for his family. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 41 years old and married with one child. She lives in Lupagan, Clarin in the Philippines.

Ellen is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Ellen has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase piglets and additional feed.

Ellen has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ellen hopes to be able to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and additional feed.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has a good credit history with KADET LTD.  He has been selling firewood  and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET LTD, after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

Simon will use the loan to buy more firewood for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for his business.

loans.name: Ezequiel Natusalen

texts.es:
Ezequiel tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, quien se ha convertido en lo más importante para ella, ya que lo ama muchísimo y día a día se esfuerza por darle una vida digna a pesar de los problemas que se puedan presentar y junto a su esposa le dan mucho amor. Ezequiel vive con su familia en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo tiene paisajes muy bonitos y sobre todos sus pobladores son muy alegres y generosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Ezequiel le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos del barrio y en ocasiones le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chilcano de Carachama”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Ezequiel solo ´pudo estudiar hasta el segundo grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera e mecánica automotriz.

Día a día Ezequiel trabaja en su parcela de cultivo de cacao, el le dedica a su sembrío alrededor de 9 horas al día, el cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es le gusta mucho lo que hace y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Ezequiel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para mantener su cultivo, de esa manera el podrá tener una mejor cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir adelante para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener más parcelas para cultivar”.
texts.en: Ezequiel is 30.  He is the father of a three-year-old son, who has become the most important thing in his life.  He loves him very much and strives every day to give him a worthy life despite the problems that can come up.  Together with his wife, they give him a lot of love.  Ezequiel lives with his family in the city of Pucallpa, which has a very warm climate and pretty landscapes.  Its people are very happy and generous.  In his free time, Ezequiel likes to play soccer with his friends from the neighborhood.  On occasion, he likes to enjoy one of his favorite meals, "Chilcano de Carachama."  Due to his scarce resources, Ezequiel could only study through his second year of secondary school, but he would have liked to become an automobile mechanic.  Day after day, Ezequiel works on his land growing cacao.  He does this for nine hours a day.  He believes that his business is going well because he likes it a lot and he is responsible.  Ezequiel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, he will be able to buy manure, fertilizers, and other items to maintain his crop.  In this way, he will be able to have a better harvest and to improve his income.  This will let him get ahead and make his biggest dream a reality:  "to give a good education to his son and to have more land to farm."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 41 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines.

Beverly buys and sells rice to earn a living and has been in this business for two years. Each month she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Beverly has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Beverly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy owns and runs her retail store. She has run this kind of business for more than 10 years. She is thankful because her gained profit was used to give her children an education and to pay for basic commodities and the monthly electric bill. 

Mercy wants to buy basic merchandise, such as cooking oil, sugar, milk, shampoo, bar soap, dish washing soap, and other necessities.  According to her, her customers buy this merchandise every day. So she is seeking financial support amounting to PHP 10,000. 

She is hoping that she can eventually improve her retail store through this loan.  In that way, she can let her children finish their studies and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy basic merchandise, such as cooking oil, sugar, milk, shampoo, bar soap, dishwashing soap, and other necessities to re-stock her retail store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, who is engaged in a hog fattening business, is applying for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase feed, vitamins and one hog. She just hopes that her hog will this time have a healthier and nourished body to make a higher income. With her tirelessly promoting their lives, she is looking forward to the improvement of her income through her availed loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and one hog

loans.name: Nolia

texts.en:
Nolia enjoys her daily routine in life. She has owned and run a general store for five years. She is 60 years of age and married, with four children.  Two children work at abroad, while her other two are out of school. 

Nolia's main priority is to buy stocks of groceries, such as sugar, soft drinks, assorted biscuits, ingredients, and shampoo, because they are marketable within her local community.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.  She is hoping for approval of this loan so she can gain greater profit, which will serve her family's daily necessities and be invested in maintaining raised hogs, and some amount will be her savings for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries, such as sugar, soft drinks, assorted biscuits, ingredients, and shampoo.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita has operated a variety store since 1997. Through her dedication, hard work and patience she is able to run this kind of business wisely, with the help of her husband. She is hoping for continuous growth of her variety store so she can provide for their everyday expenses.

Isabelita's desire is to re-stock her variety store with complete groceries to satisfy her customer demand, and also to increase her sales and profit. To help her variety store continue in operation, she is requesting a loan of PHP9,000. She knows that this amount would really be of great help, most especially in the boost of her income. She hopes to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es: El Sr. Jacobo, de Profesión Albañil, Casado y tiene cuatro hijos a los cuales solo a dos les apoya económicamente ya que sus dos hijos mayores tiene su propia actividad económica por lo que no necesitan apoyo económico pero si les ayuda moralmente con algunos problemas que se les presenta.  Hace mas de 23 años que desarrolla su actividad, le costó salir adelante y poder adquirir su propia vivienda que con el esfuerzo conjunto de sus hijos y esposa pudieron construir algunos cuartos para que puedan vivir mas cómodos, pues gracias a los trabajos que el cliente realizo en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Tarija, fue conocido por varias personas quienes hasta el día de hoy le requieren para algún trabajo relacionado a la Construcción Civil, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de más Herramientas de Trabajo para que de esa manera pueda desarrollar su actividad de una manera mas eficiente ya que no tiene una gran cantidad de puntales y eso hace que se retrase un poco con la entrega puntual de sus obras por lo que quiere mejorar y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor estatus de vida.
texts.en: Jacobo is a bricklayer. He is married and has four children. He is supporting only two of them since the two oldest have their own economic activities and don't need his support. He does give them moral support with problems that come up. He has been doing his activity for more than 23 years. It was diffiicult for him to get ahead and acquire his own home, but with the joint effort of him, his children and his wife, they were all able to build some rooms and live more comfortably. Thanks to the work he did in different places around the city of Tarija, he became known by various people who even today need him for jobs related to civil construction. That is why he is asking for the loan, to buy more work tools so he can develop his activity in a more efficient way. He doesn't have a lot of struts and this slows him down a little with the punctuality of his work. That is why he wants to improve and offer his family a higher status of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Ms Azra is 33 years old and married.  She is running a small general store in her community. She offers various items of goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list.  Her husband is employed in a small factory, but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is the mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.  She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She is in sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is a 39-year-old married man with two sons. He is market vendor and sells goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candy. He has eight years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients.

The food products he sells are very popular among customers and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 300 AZN. His wife helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This business is the sole financial income for his family. Nizami is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, which is in the central bazaar of his hometown. 

Nizami applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods he offers to cover the demands of customers. This will be his second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat is a 27-year-old woman, and married with three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. Saltanat has more than 4 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Saltanat usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch. Saltanat's monthly income is 90 AZN. Working in the open air and raising crops is taking a lot of strength, which is very hard for women, and that's why Saltanat's husband helps her. 
Saltanat needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she grows and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonella Group

texts.en:
Khadija is the featured borrower for the Antonella group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is seated in the middle. She has been selling women's clothes from her house, to help her husband in making and improving their living.

Khadija is 54-year-old married woman who works hard to please her customers and improve her living. Khadija has applied for this loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, and she will be using it to increase her business capital for a new autumn/winter collection. She does well in her business because of her special customer service and encouraging prices. 

Abir is a 35-year-old married woman, who works from her house in a beauty business specializing in tattoo work. Abir is seated on the right. She prefers to work from home to take good care of her family members. The loan she applied for will be invested in paying her son's tuition fees.

Zeinab is a 36-year-old married woman who works from her house selling women's and children's clothes to help her husband in improving their living and covering their expenses. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: to increase her business capital for a new autumn/winter collection of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo tiene paisajes muy bonitos y sobre todos sus pobladores son muy alegres y generosos. Emilia es madre de 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, a quienes ama muchísimo y sobre todo se esfuerza mucho por darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear con sus hijos y en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar junto a ellos uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Caldo de Gallina”.
Día a día Emilia trabaja como empleada del hogar, ella traba alrededor de 8 horas al dia  con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es my responsable y sobre todo porque y tiene un motivo para salir adelante, sus hijos.

Emilia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa como short, blusas, polos bivirís, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener un ingreso extra y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá luchar para poder hacer realidad su más grandes sueños:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.”
texts.en:
Emilia is 36 years old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa. It is charcaterized as having a warm and pleasing climate. It has beautiful landscapes and above all, its residents are very cheerful and generous. Emilia is a mother of 2 children, aged 14 and 9. She loves them very much and above all works very hard to give them a dignified life with much love. When she has some free time, she likes to go out with her children and sometimes enjoy wth them one of her favorite dishes, the delicious  “Caldo de Gallina”.

Day after day Emilia works as a house maid. She works around 8 hours a day and with the fruits of her labors is able to pay, with much effort, for her household expenses. She thinks it is going well for her because she is very responsible and has a reason to get ahead: her children.

Emilia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she has been able to buy merchandise to start her business selling clothes, such as shorts, blouses, polo shirts, tank tops, and more. This way, she can have extra income and improve her earnings. This will allow her to maker her biggest dreams come true: having her own house and giveing her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shorts, blouses, polo shirts, tank tops, and more)

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 40-year-old married woman, the mother of two children. She has been working in selling women clothes since April 2009, in order to help her husband in making a living and covering their family's expenses. 

Souheir is a hard worker who puts much effort into pleasing her customers and expanding her business. Today Souheir is applying for a loan for the first time from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise by buying a new autumn/winter shoes collection.

Souheir hopes that this loan will be a step forward toward expanding her business and increasing her customers.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise through buying a new autumn/winter shoes collection.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 24-year-old single Palestinian man, who has been living and working in Saida with his family since he was born. Abdullah started working early to help his family in making their living. In April 2012, Abdullah opened his present bakery to improve his living and increase his income. He sells Manakish (a special folded dough just like pizza, with special traditional toppings such as thyme, cheese and meat: a traditional everyday Lebanese breakfast)
Abdullah is expanding his business, that's why he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary tools for making Saj bread (Traditional Lebanese bread). This bread is highly requested these days especially with the special toppings he adds.
Abdullah hopes to increase his income and expand his working zone, which will help him to move to another area with increased number of customers.

loans.use: To buy the necessary tools to make Saj bread

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales,la socia cria chanchos,ovejas,vacas y animales de corral,ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar animales como ovejas y chanchos.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her business that involves farming and raising animals. She raises pigs, sheep, cows, and other farm animals. After the animals are fattened, they are sold at different fairs. The borrower already has five years of experience in this business and has done very well. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell her animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy animals, such as sheep and pigs.

The borrower appreciates and values the loan she has received in this manner. She promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner, just as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Murvet

texts.en:
Murvet is 31-year-old young man, very friendly. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his parents in Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past eight years.  Murvet was unemployed and did not have an education degree. When he got married, he needed financial sources to support his new family, so he started his business.
 
During long years of experience, Murvet gained enough skills and experience to run the business, thanks to his father`s experience, too. He chose these crops because they are profitable, and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is AZN 70.

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. 

As these products are in high demand, Murvet wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand and to increase his monthly income. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of AZN 1,500.  He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.  This will be his third loan, and he has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old and operates a retail shop. He and his wife Jane are blessed with two children. He has been a businessman for the past nine years with the monthly income of KES 60,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. John will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will invest to buy a motorbike. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for sale.

loans.name: Homme Group

texts.en:
Homme group is made up of 2 members who sell jewelry. Grace and Dorcas are 23 and 26 years old. 

Grace is 23 years old and is married to a 25-year-old mason called Anthony. They both live in Anthony’s family house.  

She took a loan from ID-Ghana at the beginning of this year.  This is her second loan and she needs 500 Ghana Cedis to be able to expand her business so that she can meet customers’ demand. She has been in this business since 2006. 

She uses her profit to support her business.

Grace, together with Dorcas, needs 1000 Ghana Cedis to buy more goods for the business.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to supply to customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 36-year-old married woman. She started a general store six month ago. She has faced a lot of hurdles in her married life as her husband is employed in a small factory. It was getting hard for him to bear everyday expenditures of family members alone. Such circumstances compelled Nasreen to initiate a business activity to support her family. She is a mother of three. She is putting a lot of effort in contributing to the family income to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. Her husband is very supportive and assists her by buying stock of goods from the market.

She needs goods of daily use to meet her customers' demand time after time. For this, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy stock of rice, flour and grains. She hopes to have an increase in her income by catering more customers. She wishes to utilize the part of profits on providing quality education to her children and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Gs Nueva Esperanza No. 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Katia es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en un Barrio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de Cuajada.
Doña Katia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de Cuajada ya que ella se dedica a la reventa. Con el préstamo ella espera aumentar las ventas al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que a diario  la visitan, al igual que mejorar el estilo de vida con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
En el futuro Doña Katia espera que su negocio crezca  y sea el más conocido de la zona  al igual que desea seguir apoyando a su familia en especial a sus hijos ya que le gustaría que terminaran sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Doña Iris de 30 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años en la comunidad donde vive.
Doña María de la Paz tiene 31 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años en la comunidad donde vive y en los mercados de Choluteca.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Katia is an honest, responsible and hard-working person. She lives with her husband and her three children in a neighborhood in southern Honduras.

Her business is selling curd. Katia needs the loan in order to buy curd, as she resells it. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales by having more products to offer the customers who come to see her daily, as well to improve her lifestyle with the increase in household income.  

In the future, Katia hopes that her business grows and becomes the best known in the area. She wishes to continue helping her family, especially her children. She would like them to continue their education, and become persons of worth, with better opportunities.

Iris is 30 years old, and for three years her business has been selling used clothing in the community where she lives. Maria de la Paz is 31 years old, and for ten years her business has been selling tortillas in the community where she lives and in the markets in Choluteca.
 

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: To buy curd for her business.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Doña Florinda de 28 años, casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabajaba de albañil ahora se desempeña como comerciante, Doña Florinda vende Frijol Negro por libra en el mercado municipal de Santiago Sac de lunes a viernes, ya lleva 8 años vendiendo su producto y es muy conocida por muchas personas y sobre todo por la calidad ella vende alrededor de un quintal y medio que son 150 libras diarias, y los sábados y domingos aun mas y su esposo la ayuda el fin de semana, este será su cuarto refinanciamiento en crédito Kiva no ha tenido ni un atraso ha logrado sus objetivos con los crédito y espera realizar mas metas que ella se a propuesto, ahora también vende algunas verduras como lechugas, zanahorias, güisquiles y tomate, a veces también manzanas y naranjas. Espera seguir aumentando su mercadería y seguir ayudando a su esposo en la economía y mejora de su vivienda.está solicitando este crédito para la compra de frijol y verduras.
texts.en:
Florinda is 28 years old, married and has two children. Her husband worked as a building worker and now works as a trader. Florinda sells black beans by the pound in the municipal market of Santiago Sac from Monday to Friday. She has been selling her product for eight years and she is well known for many people and especially for the quality. She sells about one quintal and a half, which is 150 pounds per day, even more on Saturdays and Sundays. Her husband helps her on weekends.

This one will be her forth financing with Kiva, she hasn't had any delay and she has achieved her goals with the loans. She expects to realize more goals she has set. Currently, she also sells some vegetables such as lettuce, carrots, chayotes and tomatoes, sometimes also apples and oranges. She expects to continue increasing her merchandise to keep helping her husband economically and improving her house. She is requesting this loan to buy beans and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy beand and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Orquideas De Oquendo Group

texts.es:
Fabiana es miembro del grupo Las Orquídeas de Oquendo

Fabiana es madre soltera y  tiene un niño pequeño, a sus  28 años siente una gran responsabilidad porque su hijo depende de ella, el trabajo que realiza es la venta de productos de belleza; todas las tardes por aproximadamente 4 horas diarias visita a sus clientes ofreciéndoles diversos productos como  colonias, jabones, perfumes y maquillaje. Su mayor clientela son sus vecinos del barrio, algunos familiares y amigos, el ingreso que percibe por su trabajo la ayudan a pagar algunas cuentas y solventar la manutención de su hijo, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo utilizara en la compra de una vitrina que le será de gran utilidad para  mostrar los productos que vende. Fabiana está muy entusiasmada porque siente que su negocio mejorara y próximamente espera tener un lugar con atención al público.
¡Fabiana agradece el apoyo! A todos los inversionistas por permitirle cumplir sus metas.

*Fabiana viste polo color fucsia es la ultima de la fila.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the Las Orquídeas de Oquendo group. 

Fabiana is a single mother of a young son. At 28 years old, she feels a great responsibility because her son depends on her. The work she does is selling beauty products. Every afternoon for approximately 4 hours she visits her customers offering different products such as colognes, soaps, perfumes and makeup. Most of her customers are residents from her neighborhood, and some family members and friends. The income she gets from her work helps her pay some bills and support her son. The loan she has asked for will be used to buy a display case which will be very useful to show the products she sells. Fabiana is very enthusiastic because she feels her business will improve and soon she hopes to have a place to serve the public. 

Fabiana is grateful for the support from all of the investors for allowing her to achieve her goals.

*Fabiana is wearing a fushia t- shirt and is the last one in her row.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 57-year-old IDP, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family, and also used to make fresh punch.

Adil sells his crop in the BIlasuvar central bazaar, and from his garden. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Adil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Abu. He is married and has 3 children, aged 8 months, 7 and 11 years. Two are school-going children. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him because he assists Abu in business. 
In 2001, Abu established his Stationery (A4 paper, ledger books, files, markers, flip charts, chalk, staple machines, paper punch, pens, highlighters, stamp pads etc.) business. He began his business to further his education, because he was unprivileged.  His parents were subsistence farmers and at the age of 18 years he left his parents and started mining. Abu left mining and joined his elder brother in the city to assist in his business. His brother died after a short illness and he took over the entire business. 
Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Abu earns about Le 3,070,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Abu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy various products such as A4 papers, A3 papers, markers, ledger books, carbon paper and lubricating ink.  The balance of Le1,000 after these purchases will be used to pay his labourer. In the future, Abu plans to expand his business by having outlets within the city, educate his children and build a house. The loan will help him generate more income. There are frequent increases in the rent of the shop. Abu is a trustworthy and hardworking businessman. He thanks ARD for improving his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy products for his stationery shop such as A4 papers, A3 papers, markers, ledger books, carbon paper and lubricating ink.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi is 46 years old. He lives in the Telavi district of Georgia with his parents and his wife, Khatuna. Genadi has unsuccessfully requested loans from local financial institutions several times to fund the start-up of his family business. His loan requests were rejected because of his family's low income and poor living conditions. 

The current sources of the income for Genadi's family are the monthly pension of his parents and the small monthly income of Khatuna, who works as an assistant at a boarding school. The income totals 430 laris per month and is hardly enough to provide food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Genadi requested a loan from Credo to restart his family business, which was stopped because of financial problems. His loan request was approved by a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are often regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Genadi will purchase a truck to transport wood from the forest. The wood will be sold in his village and in nearby villages. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to transport wood from the forest.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 24-year-old man who is single and lives with his parents. He makes and sells plastic and wooden doors and windows. 

With the help of AqroInvest, Karim opened his workshop after he graduated from university. His father taught him how to make doors and windows and Karim continues the family business. He usually takes orders and sells windows and doors from his workshop. His monthly income is 230 AZN. He applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase new tools and materials. This will be Karim's second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy new tools and materials.

loans.name: Leticia Margarita

texts.es: Leticia Margarita de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al comercio de lozas, tiene varios años con su negocio y ya tiene experiencia en la venta lo que le permite obtener siempre muy buenas ganancias, el lugar de trabajo esta ubicado en su vivienda pero comercia en diferentes destinos de la comunidad, como los mercados, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que siempre la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Leticia es una mujer muy activa, honesta y dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por conseguir oportunidades que la conduzcan al éxito y su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor con que realiza el trabajo, como toda buena comerciante quiere invertir para acrecentar el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar barro arcilloso, utensilios de trabajo etc. Leticia Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leticia Margarita  is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She makes a living selling stone slabs.  She has many years of experience with this business, with which she makes a good living.  Her place of work is located in her home, but she also sells at different locations in her community, such as markets.  He has a large clientele which prefers her business due to its quality, reasonable prices and excellent service.

Leticia is an energetic, honest and dedicated worker, always fighting for opportunities that will bring her success.  Her greatest secret to success is the effort and passion she has for her job.  

Like all good businesspeople, she wants to invest to increase her business, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy mud clay, tools of her trade, etc.  Leticia Margarita has good references and she assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt.  She also has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clay mud and tools of her trade.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo es muy conocida por la alegría de sus pobladores y sobre todo por la sazón que tienen para la preparación de platillos típicos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer algunos libros y sobre todo disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Frejol con aderezo. 

Día a día Fidel trabaja en su negocio como maestro constructor, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes en el día, asimismo actualmente tiene también un negocio de venta de huevos y crianza de gallinas ponedora, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque cumple con los clientes.

Fidel está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar alimentos balanceados para el negocio de gallinas, de esta manera tendrá animales mejor alimentados y tendrá mejor producción de huevos, lo cual permitirá que tenga mejores ingresos y poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa muy grande”.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in the city of Chincha, a city that is characterized for having a very warm and hospitable climate and is known for the joy of its citizens and especially for the flavor they display when making their characteristic dishes. When he has free time he enjoys reading books but especially enjoying one of his favorite dishes, the delicious beans with dressing.

Day to day Fidel works in his business as a master builder, he works about 10 hours a day and takes care of about 2 customers in a day. He also has a business where he sells eggs and breeds chickens, Fidel believes he does well in his job because he is very responsible and above all because he is dependable.

Fidel is very grateful with the support that the Kiva lenders have given him since thanks to the help he will be able to buy well-balanced feed for his chicken business, which will allow him to have more animals that are better feed and have a better egg production and will lead him to have a better income and be able to fight to make his biggest dream come true: “have a very big company.”

loans.use: buy well-balanced feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Yesenia Rosmery

texts.es:
Yesenia es una joven de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y muchos lugares turísticos maravillosos y muy visitados por los turistas durante todo el año. Yesenia es una joven muy trabajadora y con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas y abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta  15 clientes en el día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo porque atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Yesenia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá comprar más golosinas para su negocio como snacks, gaseosas, chocolates, galletas, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá más productos para ofrecer y sobre todo poder seguir adelante y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a young woman of 23 years.  She lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for having a warm climate and a number of amazing tourist destinations, which are visited by tourists during the entire year.

Yesenia is very hardworking and with a great deal of effort started her business selling candy and groceries.  She works about nine hours a day and can attend to up to 15 customers a day.  As a result of her efforts, she is able to contribute to household expenses.  She believes that her business is going well because of her desire to get ahead and more importantly, because of the warm way she treats her customers.  

Yesenia is very grateful for her Kiva loans.  Thanks to the help offered by Kiva, she will be able to buy more candies, such as snacks, sodas, chocolates, cookies, etc., for her business.  In this way, she will have more products to offer and above all will be able to get ahead and realize her greatest dream:  "to own a mini-market".

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as snacks, soda, chocolates, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Nuria Estela

texts.es: Nuria Estela de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas de diferentes estilos, son las mejores de la zona pues Nuria se caracteriza por su gran experiencia tiene un don inigualable, su negocio esta ubicado en su residencia en una comunidad muy transitada, es muy conocida y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente, siempre a la orden de los clientes; es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es muy dedicada a su labor y siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar este momento para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar periódico, alambre, cartón, pegamento etc. Nuria Estela tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Nuria Estela is twenty-eight years old and lives with her life partner and children. She works making and selling piñatas of different types, they are the best in the area since Nuria is characterized for her experience as she has an unmatchable gift. Nuria’s business is located in her home in a very transited neighborhood, she is well-known and has a lot of customers since people prefer her quality, good prices and excellent service, as she is always on hand. Nuria is a very enterprising woman with a lot of drive to get ahead in life; she is very dedicated to her job and is always looking for the best alternatives that will allow her to reach her goals. During the last few weeks, there has been an increase in demand and she wants to take advantage of this moment to start a new investment which is why she went to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy newspapers, wire, cardboard, glue, etc. Nuria Estela has good references in payments and untouchable moral character, and is sure that she will be able to pay back the debt and is hopeful that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: buy newspapers, wire, cardboard, glue, etc.

loans.name: Susana Zoila

texts.es:
La socia Susana pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende lo que son diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de arroz y leche para su negocio.
La socio se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Susana belongs to the communal banc “Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s walk together) and currently works in her own grocery store. She has been involved in this business for several years, and has succeeded as a result of her daily efforts. She sells different products like: rice, sugar and candy, amongst others. Susana is a responsible and determined person, and this is how she is able to provide for her family. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of rice and milk for her business. Susana feels thankful for her previous loan and she is committed to meet all of the established repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is a 47-year-old man on pension who is married with four children. He is IDP and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Zahid has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Zahid usually buys young cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 100 AZN of income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the one source of financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Zahid applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase one milking cow, two cattle, and fodder. This will be his 2nd loan from AqroInvest, and Zahid has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow, two cattle, and fodder

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 29-years-old, married, and has three children.  She resides in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela.  Josefina owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in order to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 8 years, earning 5,000 each month.  She requested a loan of 4,500 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  In 2011, Josefina joined GDMPC.  In the future, Josefina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan, de oficio mecánico, originario de León, su pequeño negocio  se dedica a brindad sus servicios reparando autos y motos. El financiamiento lo ha ayudado a e a tener material para trabajar, compro llantas para repuesto. Siente que le brinda una mejor calidad en el servicio a su clientela. Parte de su equipo de trabajo necesita renovarlo poco a poco, le hace falta un  buen compresor, comprar más llaves para reparación, un buen soplete. Él requiere el financiamiento para comprar herramientas de trabajo, aceite para carros, tuercas, llantas, etc.  Su meta es seguir creciendo su negocio  dar una buena atención y hacer más clientes, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is a mechanic, he is originally from León, and his small business consists of giving his services to repair automobiles and motorcycles. The loan has helped him to have materials to work with, he bought spare tires. Juan feels that he gives a better quality in service to his customers. He needs to have part of his work tools replaced which he will do little by little, he needs a good compressor, more wrenches and a good blowtorch. Juan needs the loan to buy more work tools like car oil, nuts, wheels, etc. His goal is to see his business grow, provide good service and to have more customers, all to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more work tools like car oil, nuts, wheels, etc.

loans.name: Jenny Virginia

texts.es:
Jenny, es originaria de Quezalguaque municipio de León, es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad lo cuales están estudiando en la primaria, es casada. Se dedica a la crianza de animales en especial a la de pollos, este negocio originalmente lo inicio su hermano pero el decidió dejar esa actividad y se lo cedió a ella. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, esto le ha permitido tener independencia económica, aportar para solventar los gasto en el hogar. 
Está solicitando el crédito para construir una galera para ubicar a sus pollos. Esto le permitirá  tener en mejores condiciones higiénicas y saludables a los animales. Uno de sus proyectos es también dedicarse a vender huevos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Jenny is originally from Quezalguaque, a municipality of León. She is a mother of two of 6 and 11 years of age both of which are in primary school, Jenny is married. She works breeding animals, especially chickens, this business was originally started by her brother but he decided to change his work and gave it to her. She has worked for over 5 years breeding animals and this has allowed her to have economic independence, and to bring some money home.

Jenny needs a loan to build a shed to place her chickens, this will help her improve the hygienic conditions and improve the health of her animals. One of her future projects is to sells eggs wholesale.

loans.use: build a shed to place her chickens.

loans.name: Tito Horacio

texts.es: Tito Horacio de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su hija Idalia, su hermana Mirna y su padre Gilberto en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos,  pan, leche, huevos, embutidos entre otros, tiene veinte años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en una comunidad muy transitada, tiene mucha clientela fija pero sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todos lo prefieren porque su tienda es la mas surtida, con productos de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio excelente; Tito es un hombre activo, con muchas  ganas de salir adelante siempre  esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, leche, pan, producto instantáneo bebidas, etc. Tito Horacio tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le da a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tito Horacio, 47, lives with his daughter Idalia, his sister Mirna and his father Gilberto in his own house. He has a store where he sells only basic need items, like basic grains, bread, milk, eggs, sausages, among other products. He's had this business for 20 years and has lots of experience in sales, which has helped him enhance his earnings. His store is located in a very busy community and he has a firm clientele, but his best customers are his neighbors, who prefer his store because it's well-stocked with quality products, has accessible prices and excellent customer service. Tito is a very active man with a deep desire to succeed. He's always alert to new opportunities that help him move toward success. In the last weeks demand for his products has increased and he'd like to take advantage of this by newly investing in his business, that's why he's requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will permit him to buy basic grains, milk, bread, instant beverages, etc. Tito Horacio has good payment references and is certain he can pay back the loan while having faith that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, milk, bread, instant beverages.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Doña Sabina es una mujer 47 años de edad trabaja en el campo agrícola y vive en Sololá. Ella es una persona  que a podido salir a delante aun por que tuvo la perdida de su esposo. Ella tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos que están casados y uno que vive con ella y la ayuda trabajando juntamente aportando la economía de la familia. 
Ella se dedica a al cultivo de zanahoria y papa a pocos metros e su vivienda para luego venderlos en el mercado local. Al inicio ella compraba y luego vendía verduras en el mercado local pero al darse cuenta que los precios mejoraban si ella los cultivaba y cosechaba después  así que decidió hacerlo. Ella tiene ahora 7 años de de cultivar estas verduras viendo que todo ha salido bien.
Por la temporada del año el cultivo de varias verduras se cosecha mejor,   así que ella ve su necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y abono orgánico así ella podrá cultivar mayor cantidad y mejora sus ingresos junto a su hijo.  
Ella sueña que en un futuro poder cultivar variedad de verduras que se cosechan en la región y de esta manera seguir mejorando los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Sabina is 47 years old, and lives in Sololá, where she makes a living as a farmer. Though she has faced many challenges in life, including the death of her husband, Sabina is a strong woman who always works hard to get ahead. She has three children, two of whom are married and one of whom lives with her and works with her to provide for the family.

The main crops that Sabina cultivates are carrots and potatoes. She farms a plot of land close to her house, and sells her produce in the local market. When she first started her small business operation, she bought vegetables and then resold them in the market. She eventually realized, however, that prices were improving for resale, so she began growing her own produce. She now has seven years of experience growing vegetables, and has done very well with her farming operation.

Different seasons and times of the year are better suited to growing various crops, and Sabina hopes to take advantage of these cycles by leveraging the support from this loan to purchase seed potatoes and organic manure for tending her land. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase her crop yield as well as her income. Sabina's dream is to grow a wide variety of vegetables from her region, and to continue generating income to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and organic manure for growing her crops.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años, el vive en la ciudad e Guadalupe, ciudad muy alegre y sobre todo generosa por la calidez de sus pobladores, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, limón, entre otros. Luis es un joven muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en una empresa como auxiliar contable, ya que gracias a apoyo de sus padres logro estudiar la carrera de contabilidad, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo el puede apoyar a su padres con los gastos de su hogar; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y cumplido con las labores que realiza.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a  la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites para obtener su título universitario, de esta manera el podrá obtener un mejor empleo y sobre todo poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y poder apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old and lives in the city of Guadalupe, lively city and generous for the warmth of its people. Agriculture is developed there, especially the cultivation of rice and lemon, among others. 

Luis is a young man very hard-working. With effort, he works in a company as an accountant assistant, because thanks to the support from his parents he studied the career of accounting. He works about eight hours a day and with the fruit of his work he can support his parents with the household expenses. He believes he is doing well in his job because he is responsible and polite with the jobs he does.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help given, he will pay for document procedures to obtain his university certificate, and he will be able to obtain a better job.
