He will keep struggling to realize his biggest dream: "To have his own business and be able to support his parents".

loans.use: to pay for document procedures to obtain his professional title.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Ms. Fatima is a 50-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about eight years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequences and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Fatima dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequences and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Sakir

texts.en:
Sakir is a 46-year-old married man with three children. He is an internationally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar, an IDP settlement. He breeds sheep and cattle and sells them for meat to local butchers. Sakir has more than 10 years of experience in this field thanks to his father, who taught him how to best look after cattle.

Sakir usually buys small cows or lambs, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings him an income of 80 AZN per month. People use beef and mutton in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt souse. Sheep wool is also very popular, and blankets are made of sheep wool.
   
This is the only source of income for his family and it's not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Sakir applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase one cow and 15 sheep. This will be his second loan from Aqroinvest; Sakir has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one cow and 15 sheep.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 39 years old, and is married with five children. She lives with her family in the village of Guayabal. To earn a living, Catalina is engaged in a hog-raising business. 
Catalina has been in this business for many long years and earns about PHP (Philippine Peso) 2,500 per piglet.  At this time, Catalina is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vaccinations for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinations

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has one child.  She lives in Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  Mary owns a clothes business, which she has been operating for five years.

Mary is requesting a loan for 41,850 KES, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothes.  She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are some customers not paying on time and the high cost of stock.  Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to buy new stock. Her dream is to open a larger boutique/wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Marta es una mujer que trabaja en el campo de la agricultura. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, y esta casada.  Vive en Sololá junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de los cuales 2 hombres y 3 mujeres, siendo así el mayo que tiene 18 años  ayuda trabajando en los cultivos.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de alverja, suchini y maíz en el lugar de su vivienda. Empezó esta actividad desde que aun vivía con sus padres apoyándolos en el campo agrícola. 
Con el pasar de los años deciden con su esposo seguir cultivando este tipo de  verduras por que estas mantienen buenos precios en el mercado.  Ahora lleva 20 años trabajando en la agricultura manteniendo los ingresos económicos de toda la familia y seguir prosperando. 
Ahora el maíz que tienen cultivado esta en las últimas etapas de su mantenimiento. De esta manera ven la necesidad de obtener un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar fertilizante y también el pago a los trabajadores que realizan la labor en la milpa, de este modo tener buena cosecha y obtener buenos precios.
Ella junto a su esposo quieren lo mejor para todos sus hijos especialmente sueñan construirles una vivienda digna y brindarles el apoyo para que salgan a delante en sus estudios académicos.
texts.en:
Marta works in agriculture. She is 35 and married. She lives in Solola with her husband and 3 children, 2 men and 3 women. Her eldest son is 18 and helps her with the crops. 
Marta grows green peas, zucchini and corn in her house. She started her activity when she still lived with her parents, who she helped in the fields. 
As years went by, Marta and her husband decided to continue growing this kind of vegetables because of the good prices they continuously have in the market. She has now worked on this for 20 years, providing for her whole family, and she keeps on growing. 
The corn they are growing now is at its last maintenance stages. She needs a loan of 4,000.00 quetzales to purchase fertilizer and pay the laborers that work on her plot. She thus expects to have a good harvest and get good prices for it. 
Marta and her husband want the best for all their children. Their dream is to build a decent house for them and to support them with their studies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay the laborers that work on her field

loans.name: Boston A.

texts.en: Boston is a 35-year-old businessman in Kenema city, Eastern Sierra Leone.  He sells medicines and has been doing so for 5 years now.  A native of Kailahun town in Eastern Sierra Leone, Boston is single with 2 children who are not yet of school age.  Boston has requested a loan for 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to buy simple medicines (such as paracetamols) to add to his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy simple medicines (e.g. paracetamols) to add to his pharmacy.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is single with children and lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. For the past five years she has sold clothes, both used and new. Competition and a lack of money are the main challenges to her business.

Alice learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined so she could get a loan to improve her clothes business. She is now applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy extra secondhand clothes to sell.

Alice’s profits stemming from the loan will be added to her savings to help pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to open a larger clothing enterprise.

loans.use: to buy extra second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Roseline owns rental houses. She first constructed a small house and built other larger ones from the rent obtained from the first and also from her savings. She learnt of Milango from an employee and joined the organization to get credit for business operations.
Roseline is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to finish the construction and repair of an additional house.
The only challenge in the current business is when some customers do not pay their rent on time, but Roseline looks forward to constructing two more houses.

loans.use: To finish the construction and repair of an additional house.

loans.name: Bartholomew

texts.en:
Bartholomew is 43 years old.  He is married to Francisca, and they have two children, aged 12 and six years.  He has been in the posho milling business for the past three years. (Posho is made from maize.) He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Bartholomew will use the loan to repair his posho mill.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open another posho mill business, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to repair his posho mill.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is the married father of two children. 

He owns a retail shop, a business that he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Dickson sells assorted retail products, e.g., tea leaves, biscuits, sweets, etc. 

He learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of obtaining credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is finding customers and long periods of travelling.

Dickson is applying for a loan of KES 47,100 to buy cartons of biscuits and sweets, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family, especially security and healthcare. 

His plan for the future is to grow the business to a level where he will no longer have to use a bicycle to distribute the goods but maybe a vehicle.

loans.use: To buy cartons of biscuits and sweets, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a sus padres en casa propia; él se dedica a la pesca y tiene muchos años de experiencia que le permite obtener siempre los mejores pescados y por supuesto las mejores ganancias, comercia en diferentes zonas de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que los prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y aprecios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Jorge es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abra puertas al éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar trasmallos o redes de pesca. Jorge Alberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto, age 28, lives with his parents in their own home.  He works in the fishing business and has many years of experience which allows him to always catch the best fish and of course, the best earnings.  He sells his fish in different parts of the community and he already has many reliable customers who prefer to buy from him because he always has what they need: good quality products at accessible prices, as well as good service.  Jorge is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work and with many goals that he desires to reach, always having the expectation of new opportunities that open the doors to success.  In recent weeks, the demand has increased and he wants to take advantage by making a new investment.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to purchase fishing nets.  Jorge Alberto has good credit references and an irreproachable moral character.  He is certain that he will be able to settle the debt and at the same time trusts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra stocks of secondhand clothes and shoes especially for babies.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last five months. Apart from this business, Beatrice earns salary from the family’s transport business that she operates.

Beatrice learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are transport costs.

Beatrice is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase an additional stock of charcoal and to repair the store. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of charcoal and repair her store.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: José Dolores de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia; él se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras piñas, sandias, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros, tiene varios años con el puesto y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la venta lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela y las personas lo prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente; José es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, y todo un soñador, todos los días lucha por cumplir cada una de sus metas y se esforzara al máximo hasta lograr ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y como todo buen comerciante desea aprovechar para acrecentar el negocio, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. José Dolores tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Dolores is twenty-seven years old and lives with his life partner and son in their own house.  He makes a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables: pineapples, watermelons, tomatoes, onions, and chiles, among other items.  He has been working in this position for several years and has gained a lot of experience in selling, which has allowed him to make the best profits.  He already has many customers and people prefer him to others because of his high-quality products, affordable prices, and his unparalleled service in filling customer's orders.  

José is an enterprising man, is dedicated to his work, and is a dreamer.  Every day he fights to meet each of his goals and he will work himself to the maximum until he is successful.  In the past few weeks, demand has increased, and like a good businessman, he wishes to take advantage and grow his business.  He needs capital for this to happen, and is therefore requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

José Dolores has good payment references and is very responsible.  He ensures that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time, he trusts he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Ms Farzana is a 48 year old married woman. She is a mother of four. Farzana has been in the business of the cloth trade for many years. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. Farzana is making enough to lead a decent life. 

Her husband is employed in a small retail store but his income is not sufficient to bear all the daily expenditures of his family members alone. Farzana is highly contributing to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her customers. However due to low cash in hand she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 15,000 Rs (Pakistan rupi) to buy a wide variety of clothes and in larger quantities to add to her new ones. She is very thankful to Kiva and Kashf.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of clothes.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba, 43, is married and lives in West Point, Liberia. She has four children between the ages of seven and 28. Three of the children attend school while the oldest child works.

For the past four years Kumba has had a booth in her community where she sells soft drinks, beer, stout and gin. Less business during the rainy season is a problem. Nevertheless, she is proud of her enterprise because with her profits she not only restocks her booth but helps support her family as well.

Kumba is applying for a 25,000 LRD loan from BRAC to buy more stock for her booth. Her plan is to pay for a higher level of education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her booth.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es de la cuidad de Luque, son 19 mujeres que desean ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Y así darles un futuro digno sin privaciones.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella esta casada con el señor Roberto, con quien tiene 3 hijos . Ella solicito  el crédito  para la compra de una cocina Eléctrica para ganar mas tiempo y comodidad en la fabricación de sus comestibles. Maria tiene como meta ir creciendo en su negocio y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Koeju is a group of 19 women from the city of Luque who work in order to help their families and give them a future without hardships. 

Maria sells food. She is married to Roberto and they have 3 children. She asks for a loan to buy an electric stove to make it faster and more comfortable to prepare the food she sells. Maria's goal is to grow her business and thus continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy an electric stove for making food.

loans.name: Al-Mostagbl Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-mostagbl and consists of four members who are all females; all of them are friends from Aden, Yemen. The group took a loan of 350,000 YER.

Najwa is the leader of their group (she is the second lady standing on the left). She is 32 years old, divorced with two children and lives in Aden. 

Her main business is livestock; she buys and sells sheep and goats. She has been in business for six years. She started her business with a small amount of capital. She is taking a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business. She will purchase sheep and goats to increase her savings. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña Katupyry se inician en el 1er ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos.
La señora Leila es parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela y gracias a sus ingresos esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee of women called Kuña Katupyry is beginning its first loan cycle, in the jointly and severally liable form of the program. In addition to the independent work of each one, they also develop group activities to raise funds.

Señora Leila is part of the group. She sells clothing, and she comments that it is going very well for her, since she has very good customers, and thanks to her income she is making progress and is helping her relatives. She is applying for the loan to buy summer clothing, since the heat is coming and she wants to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania, 37, is married and lives with four other family members in Amman, Jordan. For cultural reasons she prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her son.

Rania is requesting a loan of 800 JOD from Tamweelcom to buy blankets to resell to her friends and neighbors. She would like to expand her project to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blankets to resell.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá con su esposa, con quien tienen dos hijos. Él se dedica al servicio de fletes como taxista de dicha en su comunidad desde hace como 6 años, y tiene su propia parada.
Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, anteriormente trabajaba dependiendo de otras personas, pero gracias a su trabajo se pudo independizar y de esa forma salir adelante.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de repuesto para su vehículo ya que ese este es su herramienta de trabajo y lo que le permite tener su pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Blas, 33, lives in the city of Itá with his wife, with whom he has two children. He has been part of a charter taxi service in his community for 6 years and has his own stop. He tells us that with a lot of hard work and sacrifice he is getting ahead. Before he used to work and be dependent on others, but thanks to this job he was able to become independent and move forward. 

The loan requested is to buy repair parts for his vehicle since it is his work tool and is what allows him to bring home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has two school-going children. 

Peter owns rental houses. He has been in the business for the past 15 years. He learned of Milango from an employee and joined the organization to get credit for his business operations.

Peter is applying for a loan of KES 83,500 to buy building materials for the construction of another rental house. The only challenge has been the lack of capital for business growth. 

Peter looks forward to building more rental houses in future and believes this will help him access more income to improve the living standards of his  family.

loans.use: To buy building materials for the construction of another rental house.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que están dentro de este comité, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que desean salir adelante y es por esto que se esfuerzan. La Sra. Gladys, una de la miembros, es costurera y cuenta que esta acompañada hace 10 años con el señor Jorge con quien tiene 2 hijas.
Ella solicitó  el crédito  para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos para la confección de prendas para bebe. Gladys tiene como meta ir creciendo en su negocio e ir comprando mas maquinas de coser y  brindando así un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: There are 20 women in this communal bank. They are female heads of their households who want to advance, and this is why they strive. Señora Gladys, one of the members, is a seamstress, and she comments that she has been with Señor Jorge, with whom she has two daughters, for 10 years. She is applying for the loan to buy fabric, needles, and thread to make baby clothing. Gladys has a goal of continuing to grow in her business, buying more sewing machines, and thus offering a better life style to her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread to make baby clothing.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is a resident of Changamwe of Coast province, Kenya. She is a mother of one school-going child. Anjelina runs a food stall, a business that she has been operating for nine months. In this business, she basically sells potatoes wholesale. Besides this, she is also employed at an export processing zone.
She learnt about Milango through an employee an approached them with the goal of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is some customers not paying on time and the seasonal business climate.
Anjelina is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of potatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard. She aspires to open a cafe in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 48-year-old married man, father of three children. He has been working in his convenience store for 15 years ago. He always updates his business with special-release products, attractive for his customers.
Husein is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise of special-offer merchandise especially for the autumn/winter season.
This is Husein's ninth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower and his repayment history is in good standing. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his living situation and increasing his merchandise. 
Husein hopes to keep on expanding his business to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of special-offer merchandise

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
El Comité SANTA TERESITA esta empezando a trabajar, están en el primer ciclo y tienen como meta poder superar todo aquello que les está costando para salir adelante, son mujeres con determinación y gran fe.
La  Sra Gregoria forma parte de esta lucha, ella vende bebidas y carbón  y cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder comprar bebidas y carbón, ya que tiene muy buena venta y quiere seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
El grupo agradece por la oportunidad de crecimiento que reciben y se comprometen a seguir trabajando juntas y unidas.
texts.en:
The committee Santa Teresita is starting work on their first lending cycle. Their goal is to be able to overcome all of the things that are keeping them from getting ahead. They are women with determination and great faith.

Gregoria is part of this struggle She sells drinks and charcoal and says that she is requesting this loan to be able to buy those things since she has very good sales and wants to continue giving her customers everything they need.

The group is grateful for the opportunity for growth that they receive and promise to continue working together and in unity.

loans.use: to buy drinks and charcoal.

loans.name: Nisar

texts.en: Ms Nisar is a 45-year-old married woman. Nisar and her husband are currently involved in a live stock business that is being run at their house. The man shown in the photo is Nisar’s husband.  Her husband was running this activity alone since his childhood. But right after the marriage, Nisar felt that her husband is overburdened and unable to manage indoor and outdoor activities at the same time with efficiency. Then she decided to take charge of the in-house job of managing cattle. Both Nisar and her husband are happy with their business and have an idea of business expansion for the secure future of their children. They want to use the loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more goats right after the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event of Muslims) so that they can get them at cheaper rates.

loans.use: To purchase more goats.

loans.name: Umanzi

texts.en:
Umanzi lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of five school-going children and owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for two years. In this business, Umanzi sells greens, fruits, vegetables etc. 
Umanzi learnt about Milango through a friend and approached them with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock, and the seasonal business climate.
Umanzi is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes and other vegetable wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Son 19 las mujeres luchadoras que se unieron por salir adelante, que luchan por su familia y que tratan de superarse y dejar la pobreza atrás, es por eso que lleva ese nombre el grupo.
Zunilda forma parte del grupo y con gran lucha y sacrificio da a su familia lo que necesitan, ella comenta que por medio de la venta de perfumes que hace está saliendo adelante y le gusta su trabajo ya que es digno y por sobre todo muy honesto. Ha pedido este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio y a la vez ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
These are 19 hard-working women (Mujeres Luchadoras) who united in order to advance, who struggle for their families, and who try to better themselves and leave poverty behind. This is why the group has this name.

Zunilda is part of the group, and with great effort and sacrifice, she gives her family what they need. She comments that through the sale of perfume, she is advancing, and she likes her work since it is worthy and above all very honest. She has requested this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of perfumes for men and women and in this way be able to continue with her business and at the same time help her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nisreen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. Nisreen is a 29-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for various products such as accessories and household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the area. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by increasing her income.
Since Nisreen is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for various products to resell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 31-year-old business lady. She is married to Stephen, a businessman. They are blessed with two children aged nine and four years respectively. 

She has been in a livestock trading business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES. 5,000 which she uses to support her family. Janet will use the loan to buy more goats and sheep. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting livestock to the nearby markets.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Señoras Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Señoras Trbajadoras, se formo en la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente están en Décimo Primer ciclo,  Este grupo se formo con señoras sencillas con gran espíritu emprendedor, solicitaron a la Fundación paraguaya;  un acompañamiento, un apoyo , una confianza en ellas para otorgarles una ayuda y créditos para salir adelante.
Rebeca es vendedoras de joyas de plata y esta saliendo adelante gracias al apoyo de su grupo, que siempre están ahí para ella y la apoyan en todo. Es una persona con gran entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante y superarse a si misma.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas en plata, como ser cadenas, aros, anillos, tobilleras y demás. Están contentas por formar parte del grupo ya que les ha servido mucho.
texts.en:
The Committee of Female Workers was formed in the city of Caaguazú and is currently  in its 11th loan cycle. This group is made of up modest women with great entrepreneurial spirit. They are asking the Fundación Paraguaya for accompaniment, support, and trust, and to give them aid and loans they need to get by.  

Rebeca sells silver jewellery, and is getting ahead thanks to the suppport of the group who are always there with her and who support her in all that she does. Rebeca is a person with great enthusiasm and the desire to not only succeed but to outdo herself in the process. She is asking for this loan in order to buy silver jewellery, such as necklaces, earrings, rings, anklets, and more. 

All of the Female Workers Committee are happy to be part of a group which has helped them so much.

loans.use: to buy silver jewellery to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a poultry farm, a business which she has been operating for seven years. She has employed two other people in this business. The family also owns rental houses.
She learnt about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the threat of poultry diseases which can kill a whole batch and the high cost of feeds. 
Mary is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy chicks and chicken feeds. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay for her children’s college fee requirements. Her dream is to see her business grow to a bigger business where she can be supplying many places especially hotels.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Marlene Beatriz

texts.es: Marlene de 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hermanas con quienes trabajan para sostener su  hogar. Ella estudia en la universidad y cuenta con el sueño de ser una mejor persona, así mismo trabaja en su propio negocio en el que vende accesorios y repuestos para bicicletas, con lo que tanto Marlene como sus hermanas tratan de sostenerse. Marlene solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos como llantas, rines, cadenas y así mismo comprar accesorios como focos, adornos y otros más, los cuales cuentan con varios clientes, sobre todo de jóvenes que tienen como pasatiempo adornar sus bicicletas.
texts.en: Marlene is 24 years old. She lives with her two sisters, with whom she works to support their household. She studies at the university and has the dream of being a better person. Similarly, she works in her own business, where she sells accessories and repair parts for bicycles, and which Marlene as well as her sisters try to sustain. Marlene is applying for a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of parts such as tires, rims, and chains, and at the same time to buy accessories such as lights, decorations, and other items, for which they have many customers, especially among young people whose hobby is decorating their bicycles.

loans.use: to buy bicycle accessories to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and is a fresh juice vendor, a business she has been operating for five years now. She started the business with her savings.
She learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high cost of materials and unpredictable weather that affects the constant supply of fruits.
Mariam is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy fruits wholesale and a cooler box. Her extra income will be added to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to expand her business to a bigger one than the one she has and to serve more customers. She desires to own a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruits wholesale and a cooler box.

loans.name: Thoria's Group

texts.en: These are the six members of the TAYOUR ALJANA group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a. The whole group took out a loan of 280,000 YER. Thoria is the leader of a group. She is 41 years old. Thoria is the woman carrying the handbag in the photo. She is a tailor who has been sewing fabrics, veils, scarf and various clothes for many years. She has five children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Thoria`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine for her business. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. In the future, she would like to save her profit to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 45 years old and lives in Ghana. She is single with 2 children. Millicent sells second-hand clothing. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 600 Ghana cedis to buy one bill of goods.

Millicent has been working with ID Ghana since 2010. She is in her fourth loan cycle.

She has been using her profits from previous loans to take care of her children since she is a single parent. In the future, Millicent hopes to improve her business for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio se encuentra, en su 3º ciclo, es un comité en donde el sentido de responsabilidad se puede destacar. Todas las señoras son trabajadoras y se preocupan mucho por el bienestar de sus hijos.
Maria Lucia se dedica a la venta de Asaditos (Broshet), y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que sus asaditos son muy ricos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y desea seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne de pollo, carne, menudencias y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los asaditos que vende.
texts.en:
The group San Antonio is, on their third loan cycle, a group in which the sense of responsibility stands out. All the women are hard-working and worry a lot about the well-being of their children. 

Maria Lucia sells barbecued food (en brochette) for a living, and comments that she has a very good clientele since her barbecued food is very delicious. She is a very hard-working person and wishes to continue working in order to get ahead. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of chicken, meat, giblets, and other supplies so she can continue making the barbecued food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, giblets, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is single and owns a public service vehicle. Besides this, she is also employed.

Nasra is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts and carry out service and repairs on her van. The main challenge is the high cost of fuel. The income from this loan will enable her to save towards the purchase of another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and carry out service and repairs on her van.

loans.name: Basam

texts.en:
Basam is a 27 year-old married man, who has two family members from Sahab Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to do maintenance on the kitchen and to buy household items. He hopes in the future to open a project to increase his family's income.

Since Basam is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Reina Marta

texts.es: Reina de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien es jubilado y que le ayuda con el negocio. Reina se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, un negocio muy demandado pero que cuenta con mucha competencia por lo que Reina solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, leña, cal y otros más para poder hacer mayor cantidad de tortillas y de esta forma atender a más personas. Ella es una señora que cuenta con buenas referencias de sus vecinos ya que es muy respetuosa y trabajadora, quien cuenta con grandes deseos de salir adelante y vivir mejor junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Reina is 62 years old and lives with her husband, who is retired and helps with the business. Reina makes tortillas, which is a business that has a lot of demand but she has a lot of competition. This is why Reina is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn in bulk, wood, lime and other items to make a greater quantity of tortillas and thus serve more people. 

Reina is a lady who has good references from her neighbors and is very respectful and hardworking,  She has a great desire to succeed and live well with her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Ms. Rozi is a 24-year-old married woman. It was very difficult for her to feed her children when her husband was struggling hard to earn bread and butter for his family. Rozi’s husband could not earn enough to survive. She then started stitching clothes in her house with funds from Kashf Foundation. She works hard day and night to make her work well-known to be able to provide food for her family. Rozi works tirelessly to keep the business running because she knows that she is the only who can work and be the breadwinner of the house. There are five dependents on one woman since none of Rozi’s children are old enough to earn themselves. All of her children go to school. 

She told Kashf that it was getting extremely difficult to manage the family as her business was running on the minimum necessities and was unable to meet bigger deals. That’s when Rozi decided to take another loan from Kashf Foundation to boost her business by getting her younger sister in her business. For that purpose, she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) to purchase a new multitasking automatic sewing machine. She is very happy with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new multitasking automatic sewing machine.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 36-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working in transportation since 12 years ago. Hasan is well-known in the region with his loyal customers' confirmation about his good manners and hard work.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy firewood necessary to get ready for the coming winter season. He lives in a very cold area, and he has to make sure that his family is getting a suitable temperature during the cold season to keep them in a healthy living medium.

This is Hasan's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes that the second loan cycle will be invested in continuing to build his house.

loans.use: To buy firewood necessary to get ready for the coming winter season.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos pasteles, pupusas, atol, tamales, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y tiene mucha experiencia en la preparación de la comida, su negocio esta ubicado en su residencia en una comunidad muy transitada de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene ricos platillos a precios accesibles, elaborados con materia prima de calidad y con un servició inigualable; Santos es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa, decidida y muy luchadora dia a dia se esfuerza por lograr sus propósitos y no descansara hasta lograr el éxito que tanto desea porque sabe que obtendrá un futuro mas prospero, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, frijoles, quesillo, elote, pollo, carne, etc. Santos tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her children. She makes a living by selling snacks such as pies, pupusas, atole, and tamales, among others. She has had the business for several years and has lots of experience in food preparation. Her business is located in her home in a busy community. She has a lot of customers who prefer her business because she always has delicious food at affordable prices, made with quality ingredients and with unequalled service. Santos is a woman who is dedicated to her work. She is active, determined, and very tenacious; day by day she strives to achieve her goals and she will not rest until she achieves the success she so greatly desires because she knows that it will bring a more prosperous future. 

Like all good storekeepers, she wants to increase the business and make a new investment, but for this she needs capital for backing. For this reason, she is asking Apoyo Integral for a loan which will allow her to buy maize, beans, cheese, corn, chicken, meat, etc. Santos has good references to vouch for her payment history and is very responsible; she guarantees that she will pay off the debt and, at the same time, believes the loan will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: maize, beans, cheese, corn, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is from a small village of Vani district. He is 45 years old and lives with his wife, son and mother. His mother is a pensioner. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, Tamaz runs a small dairy farm; he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, he has two pigs and sells piglets locally. Besides this, Tamaz owns a vineyard and a nut garden. He sells his agricultural products -- cheese, wine and nuts -- at the local open market. He is a very hard-working man, with a rich experience in his work.

Tamaz has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan he plans to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow Tamaz to receive more milk for his dairy and increase the sales. This will give him an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions. Tamaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for six years. 

She learned about Milango through an employee and joined Milango with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and the high purchase prices of the clothes.

Rosemary is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to have a permanent site for the business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia vende productos secos como habas,trigo y cebada y lo vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia se dedica a este negocio 6 años y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender los cereales La socia solicita el credito para comprar habas,trigo y cebada.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en: Agripina still works in agriculture.  She sells dry goods such as beans, wheat, and barley and she sells her products in various markets.  She has had this business for 6 years and it is going well.  She works from 6am to 4pm.  Her dream is to have a shop to sell grains.  She is requesting a loan to purchase beans, wheat, and barley.  She appreciates and values receiving a loan through this channel and promises to be disciplined with making her payments, as she has been with her prior loans.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat, and barley.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman from Corella, Bohol. She is a mother of three children ages 15, 10 and 4 years old. She has been in the charcoal business for five years. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional wood, coco shell and sacks. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand the charcoal business to improve her livelihood and to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, coco shell and sacks.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Medalla Milagrosa” están  en el ciclo numero 11, con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio ya que son muy unidas y se ayudan las unas a las otras por salir adelante y de esa forma hacer que sus hijos tengan todo lo que necesitan.
Una de las miembros del grupo es la Sra. Gertrudis, quien con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo que es la venta de prendas. Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar camisas, shorts, camisillas, y demás prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder dar buena variedad a sus clientes.
Todas ellas están contentas por formar parte del grupo, ya que les está ayudando mucho el comité.
texts.en:
This group, called "Medalla Milagrosa", is on its eleventh loan cycle and has 17 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighbourhood as they are very unified and all help each other to get ahead, in this way making sure their children have everything they need. 

One of the members of the group is Gertrudis, who, with great effort, is getting ahead and helping her family by selling garments. She is requesting the loan in order to be able to buy shirts, shorts, sleeveless shirts, and other summer garments, since it is getting warmer. She wants to be able to offer a wide variety to her customers. 

They are all content to be part of the group as it is helping them a lot.

loans.use: to buy summer garments to sell.

loans.name: Kiswaras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de fruta y verdura, panadera, venta de queso, venta de tucumanas, venta de cerveza, tejido de chompa, venta de salchipapa, venta de medicamentos, venta de comida, venta de pan.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de pan; cuenta este negocio lo adquirió de su madre quien trabajaba en este rubro, posteriormente ella se hizo caso del negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina, leña y manteca) que adquirirá de la ciudad e La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las terminales de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud.

Ena la fotografía no esta presente el señor Alfredo, por raones culturales no quizo salir en la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kiswaras” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. The group consists of 12 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Damiana as its president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as a grocery store, selling fruits and vegetables, a bakery, selling cheese, selling beef turnovers, selling beer, weaving sweaters, selling sausages and potatoes, selling medicines, selling food, and selling bread.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Damiana who is a member of the group. She says that this is the first time she has joined a group with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from one Pro Mujer’s promoters who visited her at her home. Damiana currently has a business of making bread. She took over this business from her mother, who was in the same line of work. Her business would eventually go on to consume most of her time.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing flour, firewood, and butter. These supplies will be acquired in the city of La Paz and used later in making her products that will be sold at the bus terminals in El Alto. Working in this manner makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family. Damiana is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Damiana says that she enjoys the savings and the health program. In the photograph, Sr. Alfredo is not present. He did not want his picture taken for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, and butter.

loans.name: Dúo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Damas Laboriosas.
La señora Sara Del Rosario, de 42 años de edad, es originaria de Antigua Guatemala, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano(ropa Americana) ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años ya que por medio del negocio se han ayudado bastante y poco a poco han podido salir adelante, ya por medio de sus ingresos ayuda a su hijo que está estudiando en la universidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa de segunda mano para la venta.
texts.en:
“Damas Laboriosas” (Working Women) Group

Sra. Sara Del Rosario is 42 years old and originally from Antigua, Guatemala. She sells secondhand American clothing. Sara has been in business for five years and it has enabled her to move forward little by little. With her earnings, she is able to help her son who is studying at the university.

Sara is requesting a loan in order to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela .A Reinaldo le encanta manejar carro. Pero un día  Reinaldo se pudo  comprar un vehículo con dinero que él había ahorrado. La cual hoy es el ingreso económico para su  toda su familia  el modo de trabajar del El es de diferentes horarios  y lo realiza con un ayudante que tiene porque hacen, fletes, mudanzas .Con el préstamo va a comprarse herramientas que le hace falta al carro y pintar su carro etc.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 55 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He enjoys driving cars, but one day he bought a vehicle using the money he had saved. Today this vehicle is used to generate income for his entire family since it provides him with a means of working. Reinaldo works according to different schedules and he has an assistant that helps him with hauling cargo and location moves.

This loan will be used to paint his vehicle and to buy accessories that his vehicle is lacking.

loans.use: to buy accessories for his vehicle and to pay to have it painted.

loans.name: El Moralito Group

texts.es: Ana Laura tiene 30 años de edad, dice que su pasatiempo favorito es irse a correr por las tardes para quitar un poco el estrés de andar de un lugar a otro. Ella pertenece al grupo llamado el Moralito y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque así se llama la colonia donde viven y donde se reúnen, ella platica que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior como calcetines para caballero, tines, tobilleras, calcetas para niña y niño, tangas, pantaletas para dama, bóxer para caballero etc. Dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace mas de 2 años y que le va muy bien en las ventas ya que tiene sus clientes que le hacen pedidos por mayoreo ya  que ella se va a surtir a la ciudad de México a las fabricas donde los hacen y ahí le dan un mejor precio, dice que cada 15 días va a surtirse ya que también tiene un pequeño puesto en un tianguis que ponen cerca de su colonia los domingos y ahí va a vender. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para poder comprar un poco mas ya que también quiere poner un puesto más grande los días jueves que es cuando es el tianguis de la población y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias. Dice que ella tiene un sueño que es el poner un negocio estable para así estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos los cuales son 3 y estudian dos en la primaria. Los otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, Maria Felicitas, Oliva, Ana Lilia, María Virginia, Beatriz, Pablo y María Elena ellos invertirán en sus negocios de cosméticos y perfumería para vender, en ropa para dama y caballero para su venta, en insumos para panadería, en zapatos de diferentes marcas y modelos para venta por catalogo, para surtir frituras, dulces, insumos para elaborar hot cakes, churros rellenos para vender en ferias, jugeuetes para vender en puesto de ferias, insumos para hacer hamburguesas, hot dog.
texts.en: Ana Laura is 30 years old.  She says her favorite pastime is to go for a run in the afternoons to relive a bit of the stress of going from place to place.  She belongs to a group called el Moralito and says that they chose this name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they live and meet.  she tells us that she sells underwear such as men’s' socks, ankle socks, boys' and girls' socks, thongs, ladies' panties, men’s' boxers, etc.  She has had this business for over 2 years and her sales have been very good. She has customers who place wholesale orders since she gets her stock in Mexico City at the factories where the clothes are made and she gets a better price.  She says that every 15 days she goes to purchase additional stock, since she also makes sales at a small stand she has at a market near her neighborhood on Sundays. She is requesting this loan to purchase more stock and she also wants to set up a larger stand on Thursdays when there is a local market, in order to increase earnings.  She tells us that her dream is to set up a stable business so that she can spend more time with her 3 children, who are all in primary school.  The other 9 members of the group are Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, Maria Felicitas, Oliva, Ana Lilia, María Virginia, Beatriz, Pablo and María Elena. They will invest in their business selling cosmetics and perfumes, in buying women’s and men's clothing for sale, in ingredients for a bakery, in different brands and styles of shoes for sale by catalogue, to stock up on fried foods, candy, ingredients to make hot cakes, filled churros to sell at fairs, toys to sell at fairs, and ingredients to make hamburgers and hot dogs.

loans.use: to purchase underwear such as men's socks, ankle socks, girls' and boys' socks, thongs, ladies' panties, mens' boxers, etc.

loans.name: Las 5 Amigas Group

texts.es:
"Las 5 Amigas" es un grupo integrado por 5 personas, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica: Micaela se dedica a la venta de ropa, Sandra a la venta de manualidades, Reyna a la venta de pollo, Felipe a la venta de pan y Elodia a la venta de fruta. Este grupo se ubica en la comunidad de Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa en la cual hay mucho comercio ya que la gente de comunidades cercanas bajan a este lugar ha hacer sus compras.

Doña Micaela platica que solo estudio primaria ya que sus papas no pudieron darle mas estudios así que aprendió a trabajar desde muy pequeña en la labores del hogar y sus padres le enseñaron que solo trabajando se sale adelante. Ella es madre soltera y dice que desde que se convirtió en mamá ha trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pero hace 5 años decidió abrir su propio negocio de venta de ropa ya que se dio cuenta de que se gana mas trabajando en su propia actividad y tiene mas tiempo para atender a sus hijos. Ella inició con sus ventas de ropa de casa en casa, pero actualmente tiene un local en el cual exhibe y vende sus prendas, ella esta muy contenta ya que vende un poco mas y su negocio esta prosperando, ella invertirá este crédito en compra de variedad de camisas, short, pantalones, vestidos, blusas y ropa interior para resurtir su negocio. Ella desea futuro poder dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional y así tengan mas oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en:
“Las 5 Amigas” [The Five Friends] is a group made up of 5 people. Each of them has a business: Micaela sells clothing; Sandra sells craft items; Reyna sells chicken; Felipe sells bread; and Elodia sells fruit. This group is located in the community of Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa, where there is a lot of commerce because the people in nearby towns come down to this town to do their shopping.

Micaela explains that she only finished primary school because her parents couldn’t provide her with more schooling. So, she learned to do housework from the time she was very young, and her parents taught her that she would only get ahead through hard work. She is a single mother and says that since the time she became a mother she has worked very hard to provide for her children. Five years ago she decided to open her own business selling clothing because she realized that she would earn more working in her own business, and she also has more time to take care of her children. She began selling clothing from her house, but now she has a store where she can show and sell her clothing. She is very happy because she sells a little more and her business is prospering. She will use the loan to buy a variety of shirts, shorts, pants, dresses, blouses, and underwear to stock her business. For the future she hopes to be able to give her children the opportunity to study for a professional career so they can have more opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shorts, blouses, underweary, shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a 45-year-old man, divorced and bringing up four children alone. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Yashar breeds sheep, which he has done for the past 12 years. 

Yashar usually buys lambs and fattens them for three to six months and then resells for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN, and this business is the main source of income for his family. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His older son helps Yashar to look after the sheep.

Yashar wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase 15 sheep and feed for the sheep.  This will be his second loan from AqroInvest CU, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and feed for the sheep

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the Kongowea area of the Coast province. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a boutique for secondhand textiles which she has been operating for five years now. In this business, she sells curtains, mainly. Apart from this, she earns additional salary through a butchery business too.

She learned about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are increase of purchasing prices of the product and debt. Rehema is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of textiles such as bed sheets, curtains, etc for her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees. Her future plan is to expand the business and starting her own saloon.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of textiles including bed sheets, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La Señora Flor es otro miembro del grupo Vista Hermosa, ella tiene la edad  de 26 años, solo estudio tercer grado de primaria, esta casada con el señor Jose Luis que trabaja como jornalero y tiene dos hijos. Doña Flor platica que hace cuatro años decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y perfumería con la intención de obtener un ingreso extra con el cual ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, ella dice que inicio vendiendo con sus familiares y vecinos poco a poco fue ganando clientes y actualmente no solo vende en su comunidad sino que sale a las comunidades cercanas a ofrecer sus productos, la manera en que ella realiza su actividad es saliendo por las tardes a mostrar sus catálogos a sus clientes y levantar pedidos los cuales surte y posteriormente entrega a sus clientes, ella esta muy contenta ya que sus ventas le han dado la oportunidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Un crédito de VisionFund le dará a doña Flor la oportunidad de comprar variedad de cosméticos(delineadores, labiales, maquillajes, sombras, esmaltes) y perfumes para continuar realizando sus ventas.

ella quiere que su negocio progrese cada día ya que espera que a futuro sus hijos puedan estudiar un profesión.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Maria Esther venta de cosmeticos
Obdulia venta de pollo 
Rosa venta de cosmeticos 
Patricia venta de calzado 
Estela venta de postres
Imelda cultivo y venta de maiz
texts.en:
Flor is another member of the Vista Hermosa group.  She is 26 years old and only completed school through the third grade.  She is married to Jose Luis who is a day worker and they have two children.  Flor tells us that 4 years ago she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and perfume to make a little extra money to help out her husband with the household expenses. She started out selling to family and neighbors, and little by little she expanded her clientele.  Today she doesn't only sell in her own community but she also goes to nearby communities to offer her products.  She goes out in the afternoons to show catalogs to her clients and take orders.  She then buys the products and delivers them to her customers.  She is very happy because her sales have given her an opportunity to provide her family with a better quality of life.  A loan from VisionFund will give Flor the opportunity to purchase a variety of cosmetics (lip liners, foundations, eye shadows, nail polish) and perfumes to continue making sales.  She wants her business to make progress every day and hopes that in the future her children will be able to study for a profession. 


The other members of the group are:

Maria Esther cosmetics sales
Obdulia chicken sales
Rosa cosmetics sales 
Patricia shoe sales 
Estela dessert sales
Imelda growing and selling corn

loans.use: to purchase perfurme and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food products and vegetables.

loans.name: Zainib

texts.en:
Zainib is a 40-year-old, energetic, married woman. She has seven children and her husband is a sales man at a butcher shop.  With the help of her husband, she initiated the work of making brushes for sweeping, painting etc. One of her son assists in selling the brushes to the people of the community. She makes enough to lead her family circle. 

In order to increase her sales, she first took a loan from Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor. Now she is been in association with Kashf Foundation for six years. Her past records show her excellent repayment behavior. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy wooden and steel handles large quantity for brushes. She is hoping to earn more income through her large sales. She desires to spend the part of income on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy wooden and steel handles in large quantities for brushes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from Ghana. She is a 48-year-old client. She is single and has one child. She is the only provider for the family. Her brother, who is unemployed, lives with her.

Elizabeth owns a hairdressing shop. She has two apprentices. In 2005, she established her own hair dressing shop. She has trained seven ladies who are now working on their own. She needs 800 Ghana cedis as her 3rd loan to buy wigs, weave-in hair extensions, shampoo, and hair conditioners to sell.  

She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family better life conditions.

loans.use: To buy wigs, weave-in hair extensions, shampoo, and hair conditioners to sell to customers.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns an animal farm, which he has been operating for a month, where he sells goats.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 
Abdalla is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy animals. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His dream is to see his business grow to a better business.

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es otro integrante de este grupo, ella tienen la edad de 26 años, estudio la preparatoria y esta casada con Edi con quien tiene un hija, ella nos platica que en su casa le enseñaron siempre a trabajar desde pequeña por esto ahora que esta casada ha puesto su propio negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo a brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.

Esperanza realiza ventas de hot-dog y hamburguesas los fines de semana(viernes, sábado y domingo) en un pequeño local que renta en el centro de su comunidad, ya tiene 3 años realizando esta actividad por lo cual ya tiene sus clientes que siempre le hacen el gasto, lo que mas le gusta a ella de su actividad es que solo es el fin de semana y el resto de la semana puede atender a su familia. 

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de salchichas, carne, pan, mayonesa, catsup, mostaza, tomate, Chile, cebolla, tocino, aceite, cebolla y refrescos para la elaboración de su comida.

Ella quiere que su negocio continué creciendo e invertir sus ganancias en la compra de algunas sillas y mesas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Los demás clientes son:

Reyna venta de antojitos 
Rosa Maria venta de bisuteria
Martha venta de antojitos
Teodulo herreria 
Rodolfo venta de ropa
texts.en:
Esperanza is another member of this group.  She is 26 years old.  She attended school through high school and is married to Edi, with whom she has a daughter.  She tells us that in her home she was taught from a very young age to work which is why now that she is married she has set up her own business in order to help her husband provide a better quality of life to their daughter. 

Esperanza sells hot dogs and hamburgers on the weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) in a small stand that she rents in the middle of her neighborhood.  She has had this business for 3 years so she has customers who always make purchases.  What she likes best about her work is that it is only on the weekends so that she can spend the rest of the week taking care of her family.  

She will use this loan to buy hot dogs, meat, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, tomato, chilies, onion, bacon, oil and soft drinks to make her meals.  She wants her business to continue growing and to invest her profits in the purchase of a few tables and chairs to provide better service to her customers. 

The other members of the group are:

Reyna  snack sales
Rosa Maria jewelry sales 
Martha snack sales
Teodulo ironwork
Rodolfo clothing sales

loans.use: to purchae hot dogs, meat, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, tomato, chilies, onion, bacon, oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Juquilita Group

texts.es:
Juquilita es un grupo integrado por 7 personas: Amalia se dedica a la venta de antojitos, María de Lourdes a la venta de ropa, Maribel a la venta de tacos, Yadira a la venta de ropa, Adela vende de ropa, Petra vende de carney  Ana Guadalupe tiene un club de nutrición. Este grupo está ubicado en una región cañera y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar. 

Yadira tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio la preparatoria y es soltera, Yadira platica que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque se gana mas y el empleo esta muy escaso la unica manera de salir adelante es trabajando en lo propio, ella realiza ventas de ropa desde hace un poco más de tres años, sus ventas son de la siguiente manera va a surtirse con variedad de prendas y por las tardes sale a mostrar sus productos a sus amigos y clientes, tambien en alguanas ocasiones le hacen pedidos especiales y ella los surte, lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que lo realiza en su tiempo libre y que ha conocido a mucha gente, este credito lo invertira en la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, short, camisas y ropa interior para continuar realizando sus ventas, ella espera a futuro poder rentar un lugar en el cual establecer su negocio.

Yadira agradece a las personas que harán posible su credito y envian un fuerte y afectuoso saludo.
texts.en:
Juquilita is a group formed by seven people: Amalia sells snacks, María de Lourdes sells clothes, Maribel sells tacos, Yadira sells clothes, Adela sells clothes, Petra sells meat, and Ana Guadalupe has a nutrition club. This group is located in a sugarcane region, and its people are dedicated to the planting and cultivation of sugarcane.

Yadira is 27 years old, studied high school and is single. She says she decided to start working on her own business because she can earn more. Also, because employment is very limited, the only way to get ahead is working on her own business. She sells clothes for a little over three years. Her sales are as follows: she supplies her business with variety of clothes and in the evenings she goes out to show her products to her friends and clients. Sometimes, she also receives special orders and she supplies them. What she likes the most about her job is that she does it in her spare time and that she has met many people. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, shirts, and underwear to continue selling. She expects to be able to rent a place in the future, where she can establish her business. Yadira thanks those people who will make possible her loan, and she sends them a strong and affectionate greeting.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricios es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Mauricio se dedica a la pesca artesanal, contando con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos. Él se ha dedicado prácticamente toda su vida a esta actividad, la cual incluso ahora le permite salir adelante. Mauricio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente. Mauricio desea darles una mejor vida a sus hijos en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a hardworking and responsible individual who lives with his two young children. He is a fisherman and has a small fishing boat and a few nets for catching seafood. Maurcio has practically devoted his entire life to fishing and it is the means by which he is able to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more fishing nets, as well as hooks and other instruments that he needs for fishing on a daily basis. Mauricio desires a better life for his children so that they can have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, and other instruments.

loans.name: Choxbajan Tres Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marina esta casada, tiene 32 años de edad, curso los 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de canasta de plásticos, inicio este negocio teniendo poco capital y hasta ahora cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de materiales, consistente en cintas y venas de plásticos y aumentar el volumen de producción de canastas de plástico, espera en el futuro  tener capital amplio. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en: Aura Marina is married.  She is 32 years old and attended primary school through the 4th grade.  She has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school.  She makes plastic baskets.  She started this business with little capital and has 6 years of experience thus far.  She has the support of her husband who works in sales. She organized a group and they are requesting a loan that that will be used to purchase materials, consisting of plastic strips and tubes, in order to increase production of plastic baskets.  In the future she hopes to have plenty of capital.  The other members of the group work in handicrafts and sales.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tubes.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Las Margaritas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 mujeres trabajadoras, alegres y emprendedoras, ella decidieron llamar a su grupo así porque les gustan mucho las flores, en especial las margaritas. Su grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Tetela en la cual el comercio en su mayoría es ambulante ya que hay pocos locales disponibles en el centro de la comunidad y la gente piensa que se vende más saliendo a ofrecer sus productos. Las integrantes del grupo son Maricruz quien se dedica a la venta de calzado; Yolanda, a la venta de ropa; Elma y Luz Elvira, a la venta de ropa tejida y Reyna, a la venta de comida.

La señora Elma tiene la edad de 41 años, es soltera y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Ella platica que como no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su madre le aconsejo aprender un oficio para que cuando tuviera a sus hijos, pudiera sacarlos adelante, y aprendió a tejer. Hace un poco mas de 5 años inicio a desempeñar lo que había aprendido ya que necesitaba un empleo y al no encontrarlo decidió ponerse a tejer y a salir a ofrecer sus productos. Comenta que al principio fue un poco difícil ganarse clientes, pero ahora hasta la van a buscar a su casa para mandarle hacer blusas de distintos estilos y zapatos tejidos, ella esta contenta con su actividad ya que le gusta mucho tejer y gana su propio dinero, ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de hijos, suelas y ganchos para la elaboración de sus productos.

Doña Elma desea que su negocio continúe prosperando para tener una mejor calidad de vida y ahorrar un poco para a futuro hacer algunos arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
“Las Margaritas” [The Daisies] is the name of a group that is made up of 5 hardworking, happy, and enterprising women. They decided to give the group this name because they really like flowers, especially daisies. Their group is located in the community of Tetela, where most of the commerce is that of street vendors, since there are few stores available in the center of the town and people also think they sell more if they go out and offer their products. The members of the group are Maricruz, who sells shoes; Yolanda, who sells clothing; Elma and Luz Elvira, who sell knit clothing; and Reyna, who sells food.

Elma is 41 years old. She is single and she didn’t have the opportunity to study. She explains that since she didn’t have the opportunity to study, her mother advised her to learn a trade so that when she had children, she could provide for them. So, she learned to knit. More than 5 years ago, she began doing what she had learned because she needed a job. When she couldn’t find one, she decided to knit and then sell her products.
