She explains that at first it was difficult to get customers, but now people even come to her house to ask her to make various styles of blouses and knitted shoes. She is happy with her business because she really likes to knit and to earn her own money. She will use the loan to buy a variety of yarns, shoe soles, and kitting needles for making her products. 

Elma hopes that her business will continue to prosper so that she can have a better quality of life and save a little so that she can make some future repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of of yarns and knitting needles.

loans.name: Mariscal Centauro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL DE CENTAURO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ladrillos, tienda de barrio, venta de juguetes, venta de pollo, servicio de té y almuerzo, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió poco a poco, según el monto de capital que tenia, en la actualidad amplio su local y su capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejoramiento de herramientas (compra de ollas y cocina) que adquirirá de la feria de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la compañía de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mariscal De Centauro” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Community Center. This group has eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Andrea serves as the treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various business activities such as selling food, selling bricks, managing a neighborhood store, selling toys, selling chicken, providing tea and lunch services, and selling meat.

This loan will be used to benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Andrea who is one of the members. She is participating in her fourth loan cycle since joining Pro Mujer. Andrea received an invitation from a promoter who visited her house. She currently has a business of selling food. Since it was established, her business has grown gradually based on the amount of capital she has. At the moment, her business and her capital have grown.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to improve her equipment. She will acquire pots and a stove by purchasing these items at the fair in the city of La Paz. Andrea will eventually use these items in her vending space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Andrea is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Andrea said that she enjoys the company of her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy pots and a stove.

loans.name: El Ayle Group

texts.es: Doña Imelda  tiene 39 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad llamada Dongu, ella es parte del grupo "El Ayle" y dice que donde hacen sus reuniones del crédito se ponen debajo de un árbol llamado Ayle y es por eso que le pusieron así al grupo para que no se les olvidara el nombre. Platica que ella ya tiene varios ciclos con su grupo y que está muy orgullosa de pertenecer a su grupo porque todos se ayudan cuando tienen alguna problemática, platica que ella se dedica desde hace mas de 25 años al cultivo y venta de aguacate y también vende chiles manzanos, nopal y duraznos que ella cultiva, dice que ella estudio hasta tercer año de secundaria porque sus papás ya no pudieron seguir apoyando económicamente ya que eran más hermanos. Imelda está casada con Demetrio quien trabaja en la central de abastos de México y tuvieron 5 hijos pero 3 de ellos viven con ella llamados Carlos: de 18 años el cual trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, Vanesa de 16 años la cual estudia la preparatoria y Fernanda de 14 años estudiante de secundaria. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito en VisionFund para comprar abonos, insecticidas y quiere comprar una bomba para regar las plantas de insecticidas ya que hace poco le cayó plaga a sus árboles y eso la tiene muy preocupada porque disminuirá su cosecha si no le pone a tiempo los insecticidas para eliminar las plagas. Imelda emprendió este negocio porque tiene un terreno bastante amplio y para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, dice que a diario sale a vender a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella; se levanta diario a las 4 de la madrugada ya que su fruta la lleva fresca para que se le venda rápido y a un buen precio, ella dice “ojala la financiera me pueda prestar el nuevo crédito para poder salvar mis arboles y pueda tener buenas cosechas ya que le he metido muchos insumos para poder mejorarlos”. La meta que tiene Imelda es seguir plantando mas arboles ya que tiene aproximadamente tiene 87 árboles y que espera seguir sembrando ya que es la herencia que les dejara a sus hijos. Los otros 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman Ivan, Ausencio y Ma Julia todos ellos invertirán en el cultivo de aguacate ya que se dedican al mismo tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Imelda is 39 years old and is originally from a community called Dongu. She is part of the “El Ayle” group. She says that where they have their loan meetings is under a tree called an Ayle, and this is why they named the group that, so they won’t forget the name. She explains that she has been in the group for several loan cycles and she is very proud to belong to a group because everyone helps out when one of them has a problem. She says that she has worked for more than 25 years cultivating and selling avocados. She also sells bell peppers, prickly pear fruits, and peaches that she cultivates. She studied through the third year of secondary school because her parents couldn’t continue supporting her economically because she had several siblings. Imelda is married to Demetrio, who works in the Central Groceries market in Mexico City. They had 5 children, and 3 of them live with her. Their names are: Carlos, who is 18 years old and works and helps with the household expenses; Vanessa, who is 16 years old and is in high school; and Fernanda, who is 14 years old and is in secondary school. 

She says she is requesting the loan from Vision Fund to buy fertilizers and insecticides. She also wants to buy an insecticide sprayer to spray her plants with insecticides because there is an infestation in her trees and she is very worried because this will reduce her harvest if she doesn’t apply the insecticides in time to eliminate the bugs. Imelda learned this business because she has a piece of land that is very large, and also to help her husband with the household expenses. She says that she goes to sell in the central groceries market in a town near hers everyday. She gets up at 4:00 in the morning so that her fruit will be fresh so she can sell it fast and at a good price. She says, “Hopefully the lender can lend me the new loan so that I can save my trees and have a good harvest. I’ve invested a lot of inputs in order to improve the trees.” Imelda’s goal is to continue planting more trees. She has 87 trees and she hopes to continue planting because this is the inheritance that she will leave to her children. The other 3 members of the group are named Ivan, Ausencio, and Julia. They will all invest in their avocado crops since they also work in the same type of business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, insecticides, and avocado seedlings.

loans.name: Samaauga

texts.en: Samaauga is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green beans and round cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. Samaauga has requested a loan to buy weed killer, snail chemicals, fertilizers, a hose, a wheelbarrow and rakes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Samaauga hopes to improve her business, family matters and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, snail chemicals, fertilizers, a hose, a wheelbarrow and rakes.

loans.name: Al-Riahin Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Riahin and is composed of four women. Wafa, age 32, is the president of the group. She is married and has two children. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. She has been a teacher for seven years. She would like to buy home appliances. On this occasion, she needs a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy an oven for her house. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her house.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Hanadi prefers that her photo is not displayed on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Hanadi is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Nasser Amman, Jordan who supports 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy women's, men's and children's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income. 
Because Hanadi is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Merlin Ruth

texts.es: Melin de 49 años de edad, es una persona muy bien recomendad por sus vecinos, ella vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para darles lo mejor. Merlin trabaja elaborando tortillas en su casa donde atiende a todos sus clientes, así también comercializa huevos y maíz. Ella quiere empezar a hacer crecer su negocio para poder percibir más ganancias por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, huevos, leña y cal, y así también elaborar  mayor cantidad de tortillas. El mayor sueño de Merlin es mejorar sus ganancias para vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Merlin is 49 years old. She is a person who presents very good recommendations from her neighbors. Merlin lives with her two young children and works hard to provide them the best. She produces tortillas at her home where she attends to all of her customers. In addition, she sells eggs and corn.

Merlin wants to begin growing her business so that she can generate more income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy eggs as well as corn in bulk, firewood, and lime for making a large quantity of tortillas. Her greatest wish is to improve her earnings so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell and corn, firewood, and lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes tiene 37 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus hijos y su esposo quien le apoya en el crecimiento de su actividad comercial lo que es venta de mercadería nueva, trabajo que realiza desde hace 12 años en su ciudad donde vive, su negocio se encuentra en un punto fácil acceso para cada uno de sus clientes ya que esta en el mercado municipal y esto hace que sea muy visitado por muchas personas.
Doña Mercedes el crédito lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, trajes de niño, bóxer, calcetines y sandalias, el impacto esperado con el financiamiento es que sus ventas se incrementen ya que tendrá una  variedad de producto para satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes con los cuales viene trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo.
Doña Mercedes los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial, como también  generarse buenos ingresos para darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre de 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes is 37 years old and resides in southern Honduras. She lives with her children and husband who have supported the growth of her retail business in which she sells new merchandise. Mercedes has worked for 12 years in the city where she lives. Her business is located in an area of the municipal market that is easily accessible by each one of her customers. Many people visit her establishment on a frequent basis.

Doña Mercedes needs a loan so that she can buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s outfits, boxers, socks, and sandals. The expected impact of this loan is to increase her sales by offering a variety of products to satisfy the demands from each one of her customers. She has worked with them for a long time.

Doña Mercedes plans to continue growing her retail business in the future. She also wants to generate good earnings so that she can provide her children a good education and experience a better quality of life along with her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s outfits, boxers, socks, and sandals.

loans.name: Muiktiyar

texts.en: Muiktiyar is a 53-year-old married woman.  Muiktiyar has been in the embroidery business for the past five years. She works day and night for the survival of her family since her husband was not able to earn enough to feed his family. Muiktiyar determined that her business requires expansion for the smooth running of her household affairs and her children’s education in the near future. For that reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation business development officer and was able to take her first loan. Funds were injected in her business successfully and the positive impact of her business revealed the truth of Muiktiyar’s abilities in terms of business management. Currently, she wants to grow her business further and needs Rs 25,000 to buy more reels of thread, frames and packs of pearls. She got her case approved by Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation ad hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread, frames and packs of pearls.

loans.name: Nery Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Nery de 32 años de edad con dos hijos que asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica al sector comercio desde hace 9 años, iniciando con una venta de ropa interior en el mercado municipal el cual lo mantuvo en ese lugar por 4 años, posteriormente traslado su negocio a su casa de habitación en donde no solamente vendía ropa interior si no que también vende repuestos para bicicletas  y venta de granos básicos, gaseosas, desodorantes, enlatados, etc. 

 antes que Nery iniciara su actividad comercial trabajaba como domestica en una panadería.  Los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido para invertir aun mas en su negocio y poderlo mantener surtido, además de que estos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que le permiten tener un mejor nivel de vida para ellos y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nery is 32 years old and has two children who are attending school. She is dedicated to commerce for nine years, starting with the sale of underwear in the municipal market. She kept it in this place for four years, and then moved her business to her home where not only sold underwear but also sells bicycle parts and basic grains, soda, deodorant, canned goods, etc. Before Nery started her business, she worked as a maid in a bakery. 

The loans have been granted to invest more in her business and be able to keep it stocked. The loans have been very helpful, because they allow her to have a better life for her and her children.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, deodorant, sanitary towels, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Замира.  Ей 45 лет, замужем и ее муж работает мясником. Более 12  лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее 2  коровы и 6  барана.  Она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Замира хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  8000  сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A woman with a huge heart and a kind and beautiful soul needs your support because she is currently experiencing financial difficulties.  Her name is Zamira, she is 45 years old and married to a butcher.  

Zamira has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 12 years: she has two cows and six sheep.  After taking care of her livestock for a few months, she resells it at the market, where she has many customers.  Her husband helps her with the business.  

Zamira would like to develop her activity but she does not have the necessary means to do so.  She is requesting a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy some livestock, which will help her to boost her activity.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a married man who lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is an events manager. He began the business five years ago. His main duties are to liaise with event organizers (e.g. weddings, promotions etc), plan logistics for such events and follow through until they are complete.

He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs, tents and fabrics. Timothy was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. His main challenges are last minute cancellations and lack of enough capital to run the business. Timothy looks forward to establishing and making his business known.  He will re-invest the extra income obtained to expand operations.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tents and fabrics.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a widowed lady who lives in Kongowea, Kenya and is an events manager. She began the business five years ago. Her main duties are to liaise with event organizers (e.g. weddings, promotions etc), plan logistics for such events and follow through until they are completed, although her main contribution is often in the form of renting out her chairs. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are in school. Besides this business, Zainab also owns rental houses and sells foodstuffs to the residents around her house.

She is applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to purchase more plastic chairs. Zainab was introduced to Milango by her friend and decided to join in order to access credit. Zainab looks forward to establishing and making her business known and believes this will help her pay for her children’s school fees. She will re invest the extra income obtained to expand operations.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 36-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working in the electronics maintenance business for the past seven years. Abbass is well known in the region with the special customer care he provides. He provides cable internet connections to houses, offices and Internet cafes. He also maintains all kinds of computers and most electronic machines. 

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy firewood to get ready for the coming winter season, since he lives in a very cold area and he must make sure that his family is living in a healthy medium. This is Abbass' second time as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good paying back history. His first loan helped him a lot in improving and developing his business. He hopes to continue developing his business and to make sure that he is responding to almost all of his family & customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy firewood for the upcoming winter season

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Mariakani, Mombasa. She is married and has six children. Lucy sells dried fish at her local market, a business venture she has run for 12 years. She learned about Milango from a friend and decided to join.

She looks forward to being a renowned fresh fish dealer. Her main challenge currently is the high cost of transportation. This has forced her to deal mostly with dried fish. She is now applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenya shillings to purchase new stock of dried fish. The income from the business will enable her to educate her child in college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es casada pero separada del esposo, tiene dos hijos los cuales son pequeños, viven en casa del suegro ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de acabado fino y el piso de cemento, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz.

Verónica trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de alfombras por más de diez horas al día; con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia,  ya que el esposo le pasa solo una asistencia familiar de Bs. 600.-

El crédito requiere para pagar sus estudios de ingles ya que por la actividad que tiene se relaciona con mucha gente del extranjero.

El sueño es poder tener su propia tienda de alfombras ya que ahora es empleada

Es la primera vez que es parte de kiva
texts.en:
Veronica is married, but separated from her husband. She has two young children and lives with them at her father-in-law’s house that consists of two finished rooms and a cement floor. The house is located in the District of Pura Pura in the city of La Paz.

Veronica works more than 10 hours a day as a secretary for a carpet company. With what little she earns, she is able to pay for the cost of food and basic services for her family. The only support she receives from her husband is in the amount of 600 BOB.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for English classes since this is a skill that will help her communicate with people from abroad. Her dream is to have a carpet store of her own since this is the type of business where she is currently employed.

This is the first time Veronica has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for English classes to help her in her job and with communicating with people from abroad.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stationery such as photocopy paper, books, pens, envelopes, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra papa,mazi,cebada y trigo,ella vende en diferentes mercados,al socia tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijo,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Our member is still in agriculture. She has a crop field where she grows potatoes, corn, barley, and wheat. She sells her produce at different markets. She has been in business for 8 years and has prospered. Through this business, she has been able to help her children get ahead in life. Her dream is to own a grocery store. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase seed and fertilizer.

She is happy about the loan and commits to pay it off.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shetu

texts.en:
She was born in 1978 and she is a single mother with three children. She lives in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon with her three children.

She has encountered a good number of challenges in her life, which include an early unsuccessful marriage that led to a divorce. She also dropped out of school because there was no money to continue paying her school fees. Ill health has also been a serious problem in her family, even to the extent of her losing family members. Notwithstanding the above-mentioned difficulties, she also suffers from inadequate capital to start and run a small business of her own, which would enable her to provide her children’s school fees, rent, bills and other items. With this loan, she intends to buy a deep refrigerator, different varieties of fish, potatoes, plantain and other small items. Her activity will assist her community, provide them with quality roasted fish and a relaxation corner after a tedious working day.

With the proceeds from this loan, she will educate her children, pay for her children’s hospital bills, plow back her profits, expand her business and increase her savings for difficult days. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the gradual installment payment and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for a deep freezer, fish, oil, spices, eggs, potatoes and plantain

loans.name: Muyoyia Group

texts.en:
Mamusu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mamusu was born in Kenema city 28 years ago. She is married and the couple has one child who is attending secondary school. Mamusu sells onions and has been doing this type of business for many years now.  

This is the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mamusu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business by buying bags of onions to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara es una señora muy responsable, alegre y trabajadora que trata de contar con una actitud positiva pese a los obstáculos. Clara elabora diferentes tipos de tamales ya sean de carne, pisques o de chipilín, desde hace muchos años que ella elabora estos alimentos por lo que cuenta con varios clientes fijos, ella los comercializa en su casa de habitación, de forma ambulante y también por encargo, lo que muchas veces no puede aceptar por falta de materia prima. Clara solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz, carne, verduras, frijoles, leña y otros más para poder contar con la capacidad de aceptar más encargos de tamales y así aprovechar la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Clara is a responsible, cheerful, and hardworking woman who tries to have a positive attitude despite the obstacles she has faced. She makes different types of tamales filled with meat, black beans, or vegetables. Clara has been preparing food for many years and has several established customers. She sells her products from her home, as a street vendor, and also by taking orders. There have been many times when she has had to refuse orders because she is lacking in supplies.

Clara is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy corn, meat, vegetables, beans, firewood, and other supplies so that she can have the capacity to accept more orders for tamales. By taking advantage of this opportunity, she will be able to generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, vegetables, beans, firewood, and other supplies for making tamales.

loans.name: Bachar

texts.en:
Bachar is a 27-year-old single man who opened his own Internet cafe in 2007 after having 10 years of experience in this field. His customers also visit him to compete with each other through a Playstation game. He is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to develop his business by buying new computers and hardware.
 
Bachar left school early to help his parents to earn a living. He hopes that one day when he has formed his own family, he will be able to ensure that his children get the necessary education to make sure that they have a brighter future.
.

loans.use: To develop his business by buying new computers and hardware

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a la agricultura,la socia simebra papa,maiz,cebada y habas,ella vende estos productos en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower continues her farming activities. She grows potatoes, corn, barley, and beans and then sells these products at the market from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. The borrower has been in this business for five years and has done very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grupo Los Globos Group

texts.es:
El joven Israel es otro integrante del Grupo Los Globos tiene la edad de 21 años, se encuentra estudiando la Universidad, es soltero, el y su familia viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una región cañera. El nos comenta que desde hace dos años  decidió iniciar a trabajar de maestro albañil porque quiere salir adelante con sus estudios y poder apoyar a su mamá con los gastos de su hogar y pagar sus 
estudios.

Israel trabaja en el construcción de  casas con diferentes personas de su comunidad que necesitan componer o construir su casa, así que el necesita comprar material de construcción y madera para realizar sus trabajo, 
el nos platica que este oficio de albañil se lo enseño su padre y aun que es un trabajo muy duro a el le gusta mucho ya que es bueno ver como la gente se llena de felicidad al tener su casa.

Él necesita este crédito para la compra de tablones, martillo, clavos, metro, cemento, palas, para realizar su trabajo. Israel espera que con esta inversión su trabajo aumente pues ya tendrá el materia para realizas su labores y seguir estudiando.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Lázara venta de antojitos 
Azucena venta de antojitos 
Alejandro estetica 
Sonia venta de tacos
Dolores venta de tortillas 
Irene venta de bolsas de manos
Juan Carlos venta de ropa
texts.en:
Young Israel is a member of the Grupo Los Globos. He is a 21-year-old who is currently attending college, he is single, and he lives with his family in a community that is located in a sugar cane region. He states that two years ago, he decided to start working as a master bricklayer because he wanted to continue his studies so that he can both help his mother cover the family expenses and pay for his studies.

Israel works in construction with different people from his community who need to build or remodel their houses, so he needs to purchase building materials and lumber in order to work.

He tells us that he learned bricklaying from his father and that even though it is hard work, he likes it a lot because it is good to see how people are filled with joy once they have a house.

He needs this loan in order to purchase lumber, a hammer, nails, measuring tape, cement, and shovels to continue working. Israel hopes that with this investment, his work will increase since he will have the materials needed to complete his job, which will in turn help him keep studying .

The other group members are: Lázara, who sells Mexican snacks; Azucena, who also sells Mexican snacks; Alejandro owns a hair salon; Sonia, who sells tacos; Dolores, who sells tortillas; Irene, who sells hand bags; and Juan Carlos, who sells apparel.

loans.use: to purchase planks, a hammer, nails, measuring tape, cement, and shovels.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a successful businesswoman and has been with Kashf for the past two years. Noor engages in a construction supplies business with the help of her husband. They used to provide construction/demolition tools at a very small level. 

Most of the time, they had to refuse their customers due to the shortage of tools. This compelled Noor to meet and describe her issue to the Kashf business development officer. She received her first loan from Kashf for the growth of her business. It helped her to buy the things needed for her operations. 

Noor is very satisfied with the support from Kashf Foundation and has therefore requested a repeat loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a large quantity of additional tools to meet her customer demand. Noor has shared her plans to move her business to a larger place. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of additional tools to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, está realizando una nueva siembra agrícola, para esto es solicita nuevamente la ayuda de un préstamo que le permite comprarse siete sacos de abono y una bolsa de semilla mejorada, también pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará a sembrar, este préstamo será un gran aporte para qué puede mejorar la fertilidad de las siembras.

Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a brindar  los servicios necesarios en la siembra,  para que sus ingresos mejoren a través de la comercialización de la cosecha, a traves de estos creditos de kiva ha logrado obtener una buena producción e ir generando los ingresos necesarios para su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa is starting a new sowing season, which is why she is once again requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and a bag of improved seed, as well as hire laborers who will help her sow the seeds. This loan will greatly help her improve her crops.

She states that the previous loan helped her to obtain the services necessary for planting seeds and to obtain better profits through selling her crops. With these Kiva loans, she has been able to yield a good amount of crops and generate the necessary income for her household.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and a bag of improved seed.

loans.name: Aabida's Group

texts.en:
Aabida is a hard-working 42-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband, son, and four daughters. Her husband is a schoolteacher while her son works as a cashier in a restaurant. All of her daughters are students. Aabida herself is a very hard-working tailor and is interested in growing her business. 

To do that, as a member of a 10-person lending group, Aabida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine and some tailoring accessories like fabric, threads, etc. This will help her to sew more dresses and to more professionally satisfy her clients' needs. With the profit amount, she wishes to open an educational center and tailoring school and to renovate her house. Aabida hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. 

Many thanks and greetings from Aabida to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the photo, Aabida is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and tailoring accessories.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque esta con un buen nivel de trabajo en su taller, y tiene la demanda de herramientas como lo son hierro de diferentes medidas, lámina, electrodos, entre otros materiales que son necesarias para elaborar la estructura metálica como lo son las ventanas, las puertas, portones, esto le ayudará para continuar en su trabajo.

El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió comprar las herramientas necesarias, para realizar el trabajo y poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, la situación económica ha mejorado gracias al crédito que recibió con Kiva.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan because he has had a good amount of work in his shop, and he needs supplies like iron in different sizes, aluminum sheets, electrodes, and other materials necessary to work on metallic structures like windows, doors, and gates. This will help him continue his work.

He states that his previous loan helped him both to purchase the tools necessary for his job and to provide great service to his customers. His financial situation has improved thanks to the loan that he received from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase iron, aluminum sheets, electrodes, and other materials necessary for metalworking.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, aged 48, lives with her husband and two children in West Point. Her children are aged 22 and 26: they live outside the home and are independent. Martha has a table at the market where she has sold pepper, onions, rice, vita (a juice drink), salt and palm oil for the past two years. 

She started her business with initial capital from her children. Due to the way that she responds to her customers, Martha makes a profit every day. With the profit, she will improve the business and improve her living conditions. Martha has requested a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, onions, vita (a juice drink), and salt for her business. Her plan is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, onions, vita (a juice drink), and salt for her business.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en: Denise aged 29. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 12 years. She sells sweet potatoes and has spent 7 years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more sweet potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 54 years old. She lives in the Telavi District in East Georgia with her husband, Malkhaz. Lia has requested a loan several times from local financial institutions for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request has been rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a small monthly income earned by Malkhaz working as a watchman at the local factory. In addition, Lia works for local farmers as a daily worker to earn a small additional income. They earn in total 250 Laris per month which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lia has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framewprk of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lia will purchase calves in West Georgia where the prices are lower than in her region. She will raise and sell them at a good price. This will increase her family's income and she will be able to expand her animal sales business. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol who has four children. Her oldest child is 28 years old. Florencia has been in the coconut wine business for seven years. She earns 3,000 PHP by doing her business. Florencia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional containers for coconut wine. In the future, she wants to expand her business in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers for coconut wine

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is 41 years old. She is married and has five children aged between 3 and 22 years. She sells bed sheets and baby clothes. She has spent five years in the business. For this time, she wants to increase the volume of bedsheets she has been selling for a long time.

She wants this loan to buy more bed sheets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more beds sheets for sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie, age 35, is married and has three children, ages between 2 and 13 years. She sells different items in her boutique and has spent 6 years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more sugar, rice, beans, and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and salt for sale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married man who is the father of one child. He has been working as a butcher since 1998. Mohamad is a hard worker who puts much effort into pleasing his customers and expanding his business. 

Mohamad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the second time, in order to start two extra businesses to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. He will open a convenience store and a vegetable selling shop: both businesses are frequently requested in his area since everything is needed in his region. He hopes to keep on improving and developing his businesses as much as he can.

loans.use: to open a convenience store and vegetable selling shop to increase his income

loans.name: Trader's Union Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone 25 years ago. Memunatu is married to a trader and the couple have two children who attend primary and secondary schools. For the past five years, Memunatu  has been selling slippers/flip-flops. 

This is the first loan that Memunatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Memunatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean leones) to expand her business: she will buy a large quantity and variety of slippers/flip-flops to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of slippers/flip-flops to add to her current stock

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Genaro tiene 24 años de edad y es parte del grupo llamado “Las Trabajadoras” dice que el entro después de que hicieron el grupo pero que la persona que hizo el grupo dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que al principio eran puras mujeres y todas muy trabajadoras y responsables. El es viudo y vive con su  mama a la cual apoya y quiere mucho, el tiene varios trabajos dice que una de sus pasiones es cantar, el sale a diario a restaurantes, cenadurías a cantar, dice que ya lo conocen y que lo invitan a eventos especiales y eso lo hace sentir bien porque  quiere decir que le agrada a las personas como canta, dice que en sus presentaciones tiene un nombre artístico y se hace llamar “Marcelo” y que le gusta ese trabajo porque aparte de que le pagan disfruta el cantarle a la gente. Dice que anteriormente él tenia un pequeño cibercafé pero que seguido se le descomponían las computadoras y también tenia juegos de video pero que mejor los vendió ya que los gastos de energía eléctrica eran muy elevados. Ahora él está pidiendo un crédito a VisionFund para comprar dulces de diferentes variedades para vender afuera de su casa ya que muy cerca de su casa se encuentra una escuela primaria, dice que su mama le ayudara a hacer chicharrones preparados de soya y cueritos, dice que él espera que le hagan el crédito para iniciar el negocio pronto ya  que él cree que si le irá bien porque también quiere vender refrescos y juguitos para ofrecerles a los niños de la escuela en la hora del receso, también platica que los dulces de diferentes variedades las comprara en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de el donde encuentre precios bajos para así ganarles un poco mas. 

Los otros once integrantes del grupo se llaman Blanca Estela, María Guadalupe, Elizabeth, Librada, Mariana, Lidia, Marco Antonio, Mireya, Jasmin, Bertha y Yolanda ellos invertirán en diferentes negocios que tienen como en material para realizar colchas, en la compra de tienda de ropa para bebe para vender, en la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de alimento para sus vacas para sacarles la leche y vender por litro, compra de fierro viejo para venderlo por kilos, en la compra de maíz, para vender masa, en la compra de alimentos para cerdos para después venderlos, para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta.
texts.en:
Genaro is 24 years old and is a member of a group called "Las Trabajadoras" (the female workers). He says that he joined the group after it was formed, and it was so named because in the beginning, the group was comprised of only women, all of whom were very hardworking and responsible. He is a widower who lives with his mother, whom he supports and loves very much. He has different jobs but states that one of his passions is singing. Every day, he goes to restaurants and eateries to sing. He says that he is well-known and that people invite him to special events, which makes him feel good because it means that they like the way he sings. He says that when he performs, he goes by the stage name of Marcelo, and that he likes this job because aside from the fact that he gets paid, he enjoys signing for people. He states that he used to have a small cyber café, but that his computers kept breaking down. He also had a video arcade, but he had to sell his arcade games because his electricity bill was too high. He is now requesting a loan from VisionFund in order to purchase a variety of sweets to sell outside his home because he lives very close to an elementary school. He says that his mother well help him make pork and soy cracklings. He hopes to receive this loan so that he can start this business soon because he thinks it will be a success since he also wants to sell soft drinks and juice to the school children during recess. He also states that he will purchase the candy in different stores in a nearby town, where he can get low prices and make a little more profit.

The other eleven group members are Blanca Estela, María Guadalupe, Elizabeth, Librada, Mariana, Lidia, Marco Antonio, Mireya, Jasmin, Bertha, and Yolanda. They will invest the loan in their different businesses, such as in purchasing material to make bedspreads, baby clothes to sell, goods for a grocery store, feed for dairy cows to milk them and sell the milk by the liter, scrap metal to sell it by the kilo, corn to sell corn dough, pig feed to sell, and seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase candy, cracklings, soft drinks, juice, and other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and yams

loans.name: Kidzunu 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Didier, age 40, is married with 6 children, ages 2 to 22. 5 of his children currently attend school. Didier is representing the Kidzunu 2 (#1) group. He has a small grocery store and has been operating this business for 5 years. He will use the loan to buy milk, sugar, cookies, sardines, and soap. His business strategy is to use the loan to buy products in bulk and then sell them individually. He is able to make a larger profit this way.
Didier has received 1 previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Didier plans to keep his children in school and hopes they become intelligent adults.

loans.use: to pay for milk, cookies, sugar, sardine, and soap for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatou est une femme mariée de 33 ans et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant chez son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni.
Après quelques années d’étude à l’école coranique, elle décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et à la vente des légumes et salade. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa tente. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans elle maîtrise son activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une amie du quartier, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle compte acheter, avec son prêt, 3 paniers de bananes, 1 panier de concombre, 1panier de tomate fraiche et 1 panier de carottes. Elle est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et souvent à Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au grand marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est mixte 
Madame Ramatou est très sollicitée et appréciée dans le marché de Bougouni. La rotation de son activité est très élevée et elle arrive à réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000 FCFA.
C’est avec ce bénéfice qu’elle assure certaines dépenses de la famille et  améliore d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ramatou is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of one child.  She lives with her child at her husband's place in the "Hérémakono Nord" neighborhood of Bougouni.

She attended koranic school for a few years and then decided to get involved in income-generating activities, particularly in buying and selling vegetables and leafy greens.  She learned this activity from her aunt.  Ramatou now has more than ten years of experience in this field and has become very proficient at it.  After being introduced to Soro Yiriwaso by a friend from her neighborhood, she decided to join the institution.

Ramatou plans to use her loan to buy three baskets of bananas, one basket of cucumbers, one basket of fresh tomatoes and one basket of carrots.  This is her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and her two previous loans have been duly repaid.  She buys her goods in Bougouni, and also frequently in Sikasso.  She sells at the Grand Market in Bougouni, to both men and women.

Ramatou is a popular seller at the Bougouni market and her products are in high demand.   She has a high turnover and she manages to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs.

Her earnings help her to cover some of the expenses of her family and also to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hilalie

texts.en:
Hilalie is 35. She is married with three children.  They are all enrolled in schools. She owns a store with various merchandise. She has been in the business for seven years.

Hilalie wants the loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, rice and salt for sale. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and rice for sale.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 42-year-old married woman. She is efficiently running a small general store outside her house. She has been in this business for the past two years. Her husband assists her by buying grocery items from the market. Manzooran shared that these two years have been a blessing for her family in terms of business growth. The income has provided for her two children who are going to school because, unlike other children in their town, their mother is able to pay for their education. 

Manzooran also shared that their life was not like this before taking out a loan from Kashf Foundation. She, along with her husband and children, lived in a one-room house which was in terrible condition with only the minimum of the basic necessities of life. Taking out a loan from Kashf helped her to pay for expenses that they thought they could never bear. 

Manzooran's shop recently underwent expansion. Now, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase grocery items, packs of beverages, and stock of grains. This will enable her to cater to more customers time after time. Manzooran intends to spend the profits on her family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, packs of beverages, and stock of grains.

loans.name: Kemah

texts.en:
Kemah, aged 27, is a single parent with three children aged between four and 10, all of whom attend school. Kemah stopped her own education in the third grade. She started her business with the small amount that she had saved in her savings club.

Kemah has been selling flour, rice, cooking oil, vita (a juice drink), onions, laundry soap, and bath soap for the past four years. She is proud of her business because she can meet her children's needs and buy goods to improve the business. Kemah is requesting this loan to purchase more flour, rice, cooking oil, onions, and bath soap, to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, rice, cooking oil, onions, and bath soap to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia vive en casa de sus padres, tiene un hijo de 10 años y trabaja en una empresa textil en el área de manejado donde percibe un sueldo mensual. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de salchipapas, pero ya no lo hace.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora, pues la que estaba usando ella junto con su hijo, quien la usa para sus tareas del colegio, se quemó y no es posible arreglarla.
Sonia es cliente antigua desde el año 2011 y su comportamiento de pago es bueno y por el carácter social califica para un nuevo crédito; sus sueños futuros son tener una tienda de costura ya que en sus momentos libres confecciona edredones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia lives at the home of her parents. She has a 10-year-old son and works at a textile factory as an operator. Sonia receives a monthly salary. She previously sold “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), but she is no longer in that line of work.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a computer. The one that she currently shares with her son, who used it for his homework, burned out and cannot be repaired. Sonia has been an established client since 2011. Her payment history is good and her social character qualifies her to receive a new loan. In the future, she dreams of having a sewing workshop and spending her free time making quilts.

loans.use: to buy a replacement computer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from a small village in the Vani district. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and 2-year-old granddaughter. Her son works abroad and helps his family financially. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a nut garden and agricultural land where maize is grown. Besides this, Julieta has a pig and she takes good care of it. She sells maize, nuts, and piglets at the local open market. Julieta works hard to make some savings and to improve her family's living conditions.

With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a milking cow. With the milk, Julieta will produce dairy products and sell them at a good price. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions as well as to expand her agricultural business. Julieta awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 43-year-old conservative woman. She asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Being a mother of five children is a big responsibility and comes with a lot of pressure. Despite all that Hiyam, wants to make sure that all of them get to university and earn a degree. One of the daughters is Lida, an 18-year-old, who has just enrolled in a course to study nursery. 

Now Hiyam has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq, a 19-year-old single man, is studying to be a teacher. He is now in his second year and is already giving private classes to his colleagues when needed. 

He has applied for this loan to pay his semester fee in hopes that in the future he will also earn a higher degree and become a teacher at the university.

loans.use: to pay his semester fee.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaraneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mustapha. Mustapha is 29; he was born in Kenema city where he is currently residing together with his wife and two children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For 10 years now, Mustapha has been selling shoes. With this loan, he will buy shoes wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Amonkul

texts.en:
Amonkul is 76 years old and lives with his children and wife in a house. He has a vegetable-selling business. He sells a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots etc. He has gained much business experience in his field.

With his profits earned from the business, he improves his living conditions. He is an intelligent and brainy man who says, "I will do all the best for my family." 

He is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to sell. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mafanta

texts.en:
Mafanta is 45 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 22, who attend school, and live at home. Her husband is a contractor.

For the past twelve years she has been selling lappa (traditional cloths), necklace chains, and others items in the local market. She makes a lot of profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa, necklace chains, and other items for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa, necklaces, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Emommahmad

texts.en:
Emommahmad is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. He has had his own business for 15 years, and it is his source of income. He sells vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots and etc.

He has not had many customers for the last while, and that’s why he decided to widen the assortment of his goods. He is asking for a loan of 1,400 USD. With it he is going to buy vegetables, as he wishes to satisfy the demand from his customers, and always keep his store well-stocked.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Warde

texts.en: Warde is a 19-year-old single lady, and the oldest sister among five siblings. Warde is a business administration student who wants to graduate early. For that reason, she has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 25-year-old single guy who is majoring in Mechanical Engineering. He is the youngest of three siblings. 

Osama has applied for this loan to pay his semester fees so he can graduate and find a suitable job and then register for higher education.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Tomah

texts.en: Tomah, 31,  is married and lives at Paynesville South with her three children aged 2,9, and 15. They are currently  in school.  For the past two years, she has  been  operating  a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She sells different types of food and she sells six days a week.  She prepares cassava leaves, fufu with soup, palava source, potatoes, greens, and palm butter. Because of the good services rendered to her  customers,  she makes profit every day when she sells.  She uses the profit to buy more ingredients for the business, and helps  her  husband  with  the expenditure  of the  family.  She has  requested a  loan to  purchase more ingredients to meet the demands of her customers. She plans to buy land and build house in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase more ingredient ,to meet the  demand of her customers.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria es una joven de 25 años de edad, ella vive al lado de su madre y de sus tres hermanas a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado y sobre todo porque se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz , entre otros. Victoria es muy carismática y sobre todo ingeniosa, ella inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas y alquiler de ropa hace 2 años a las afueras de un centro de rehabilitación, se le ocurrió la idea debido a que en ese centro de rehabilitación solo permiten el ingreso a las mujeres con falda y un día unas señoras le preguntaron si alguien las alquilaba y es desde ese entonces que se le ocurrió ese negocio, así es que ella con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración y trabaja muy duro para poder seguir adelante y también apoyar a su familia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Victoria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar golosinas como chocolates, gaseosas, galletas, entre otros y también comprar más faldas para poder alquilarlas, así sus ingresos mejorar y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera de Administración y tener una gran bodega”.
texts.en:
Victoria, 25, lives with her mother and three sisters, who she helps through her work.  Her home is located in the city of Imperial which is known for its varied climate and its crop agriculture, especially cotton, maize and others.  Victoria is very charismatic and, especially, ingenious.  She started her own business selling sweets and renting clothing two years ago outside a rehabilitation center.  She came up with the idea because the rehabilitation center only allows entry to women wearing skirts; and one day some women asked her if anyone rented skirts.  After that she decided on the business and, through much effort, has been able to cover her education costs.  She is studying business administration and works hard to get ahead and support her family.  She believes the reason business is going so well is because she is kind to the customers, mainly because she is very determined to be successful.

Victoria is grateful to Kiva lenders, because through their help she can buy sweets such as chocolate, sodas, cookies, etc, as well as skirts to rent.  This will improve her income so she can continue working toward her goal which is: "To finish her administration studies and open a large store¨.

loans.use: To buy skirts, and sweets such as chocolate, sodas, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en: Raad, a 20-year-old single man, is the second oldest of four siblings. After Raad's father retired, he started working in another job to be able to support his kids. Seeing his father working hard for them, Raad decided to concentrate on his studies in accounting so that he could help his father after graduation.  Raad has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine is a married woman with six children and she lives with her entire family in a seven-bedroom apartment in Mankon, Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon. 

She has gone through difficult moments like the loss of some of her children, the burglary of her house and ill health within her family.  Inadequate finance has also been a major hindrance. 

Celine joined GHAPE in the year 2000.  She has taken out and repaid loans twelve times.  She says that if given the new loan requested, she intends to use this the loan to buy fuel wood and increase the quantities of rice, beans, corn, cocoyams, cooking oil and all other ingredients needed to run her restaurant. She will add her pig fence and buy more piglets.  She says her activity will help the community to provide ready food especially for ever-increasing urban workers, and will improve their protein intake through pork. She will succeed because of her longevity in the business, her good business location and the high demand for pork. 

With the profit from her business, she will provide the basic needs of nutrition, health and education to her children.  Celine says she prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to pay for fuel wood, rice, beans and cocoyamsp;'/

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en:
Rasmiya is a 19-year-old single lady and the only sister of two brothers. Rasmiya is a university student majoring in Business Administration. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can continue to get a Bachelor degree in business.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a widow blessed with five children. Her entire family lives in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

She has gone through several problems in life such as inadequate start up capital and little or no assistance from her family members, the death of her husband, ill health within her family, and the theft of her motorbike. She intends to use this loan to add to her stock of rice, beans, maize and the other products that she sells on her market stall. She will also invest some in her gardening and poultry farm and also pay rent for her market stall. This activity will help the community as well as it will mean that they can access affordable foodstuff items and improve nutritional intake through the garden and poultry. It will also provide manure for farmers in her community and provide employment opportunities. She also believes in the success of the venture due to the high demand for food stuff and her longevity in the same line of business. 

The profits of her activity will be use to improve her housing conditions and provide for some basic needs of her family. She will also plough back some of the proceeds. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the management training and marketing techniques giving by GHAPE staff.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, maize and seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, desea continuar realizando su negocio de tortillas, por el momento necesita la inversión en la compra de los materiales como lo es el maíz y la leña, adquiriendolos por mayor cantidad, esto le permitirá mejorar las ganancias por las ventas, adquiriendo sus productos a mejor precio.

Ella nos comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitio obtener una mejor solvencia a través de las ganancias, hasta el momento ha logrado que su familia mantenga un nivel estable.
texts.en:
María wants to continue making tortillas. She needs now to invest in buying materials such as corn and firewood. By buying them in bulk, she will be able to improve the profits obtained through sales, because she obtains the products at a better price.

She mentions that the previous loan helped her having a better solvency through the profits. So far, she has managed to keep a stable condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 24 años y nació en Medellín, Colombia. En estos momentos está estudiando Trabajo Social en la Universidad de Antioquia gracias a que recibió la Beca PAES que se le otorga al mejor bachiller de Colombia.

Laura tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en derechos humanos en Harvard o en el London School of Economics. El apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que pueda pagar los cursos de preparación del GRE, la inscripción al examen del TOEFL y los costos de aplicación a las universidades ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para ello.

Aquí está su historia:

"The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why." Mark Twain

Como para muchos, una de las decisiones más difíciles e importantes para mí fue el elegir un campo de estudio, un proyecto de vida, el darme cuenta por qué estoy aquí. Ahora, 5 años después no podría estar más orgullosa de mi decisión: el Trabajo Social. Encontrar el vértice entre lo que amas, para lo que eres bueno y lo que el mundo necesita, es una suerte de pocos. 

Desde pequeña he tenido gran sensibilidad social, siendo parte de grupos juveniles, parroquiales, y excelentes resultados académicos; producto de ello es la beca como mejor bachiller, entonces decidí conjugar ambas y dedicarme al estudio de las ciencias sociales. A lo largo de mi desempeño académico he encontrado una gran afinidad con los derechos humanos y me he dado cuenta que su garantía es fundamental para la sociedad, es por esto por lo que quiero dedicar mi vida a luchar por su realización plena. Considero que tengo todas las capacidades para ello, sin embargo, en este momento mi único impedimento es el económico.
Soy autodidacta: aprendí inglés de forma independiente y para sostener mis estudios me he desempeñado como docente de inglés en varias instituciones. En Brasil tuve la oportunidad de participar como intérprete para la ONU en el evento Rio + 20. 

Mi promedio es de 4.2/5 y he tenido varias experiencias internacionales; la más importante trabajar en una ONG en Brasil aplicando mis conocimientos profesionales y aportando a transformar la sociedad. 
El costo total de las aplicaciones al posgrado en el exterior es equivalente a 5 meses de trabajo, sin sumarle que para realizar mi actual práctica internacional tuve que adquirir una serie de deudas relacionadas con el pago de tiquetes aéreos, mantenimiento, etc.

Una vez realice mi maestría y regrese a Colombia, quisiera trabajar en alguna de las agencias de las Naciones Unidas dirigiendo proyectos de investigación para el desarrollo de mi región.  En el pregrado tuve la oportunidad de trabajar en un proyecto de investigación con la agencia de la ONU, el PNUD sobre el desplazamiento forzado en el oriente de Antioquia, y diseñamos una propuesta de intervención. Lo que más me gusta es el aspecto investigativo de los problemas sociales y su aplicación a la resolución concreta de dichos problemas. Pero para poder influir de forma significativa es necesario tener una fuerte formación, de ahí la necesidad del posgrado.

Como parte del semillero de talentos regionales de COLFUTURO puedo garantizar que el apoyo de la fundación KIVA se va a ver totalmente retribuido en mi desempeño como profesional y el aporte que realizaré en mi país cuando regrese.
texts.en:
Laura, 24, was born in Medellín, Colombia.  She is currently studying Social Work at the University of Antioquia through a PAES scholarship which was awarded to the best high school student in Colombia.

Laura's goal is to get a master's in Human Rights from Harvard or the London School of Economics.  The Kiva support will help her pay for her GRE preparation courses, the TOEFL exam registration and application costs to universities, since she does not have the economic resources to pay for it.

This is her story:

"The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why." Mark Twain

Like for many, one of the most difficult and important decisions for me was deciding what field of study to go into, as a life-long project, to find out why I am here.  Now, five years later, I could not be more proud of my decicion: Social Work.  To find the apex between what you love, what you are good at and what the world needs, is the luck of only a few.

Since I was a little girl I have had a huge social sensitivity, belonging to youth groups, parishes, and having excellent academic results.  I was granted a scholarship for the best high school student, and that is when I decided to use my skills to study social sciences.  Throughout my academic career I have found much affinity with human rights and I have realized that its guarantee to society is fundamental.  That is why I want to dedicate my life to fighting for its complete fulfillment.  I feel I have the skills for it; however, at this time I am limited economically.

I am self-taught and learned English independently.  To pay for my studies I have taught English at several institutions.  In Brazil I had the opportunity of working as an interpreter for the UN at the Rio + 20 event.

My grade point average is 4.2 out of 5 and I have much international experience.  The most important one was working for an NGO in Brazil, using my professional knowledge and helping change society.

The total cost of post-graduate studies applications overseas is equivalent to five months of work, without including the fact that in order to work as a student internationally, I had to take on many costs related to travel tickets, maintenance, etc.

After I finish my master's and return to Colombia, I would like to work for a United Nations agency, managing research projects for development in my region.  During my undergraduate studies I had the opportunity to work on a research project with a UN agency, the PNUD about forced displacement in eastern Antioquia, and we designed an intervention proposal.  What I like most is the research aspect of social problems and how to apply it to concrete resolution of said problems.  But in order to have a significant influence, one must have a strong training background, and that is why a post-graduate degree is necessary.

As part of the regional talent seedbed of COLFUTURO, I can guarantee that the support of the KIVA Foundation will be totally rewarded through my work as a professional and my contribution to my country, upon my return.

loans.use: To pay for her masters degree in Human Rights.

loans.name: Gabriela Justina

texts.es:
Gabriela Justina es una persona emprendedora,tiene su negocio pulperia, con mas de cinco anos de tener esa actividad, es madre de seis hijos, estos ya no dependen de ella, el negocio lo atiende ella y su esposo. Gabriela  trabaja de lunes a domigo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche;tiene su clientela cercana de  su negocio.
  
Solicita el prestamo a nuestra institucion para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la compra de granos basicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, lacteos; esto con el proposito de tener mayor variedad de productos y ofrecer mas articulos a sus clientes, con el proposito de captar mas compradores, el credito anterior lo invirtio en su negocio en la compra de mas productos para su establecimiento.

Agradece a Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este credito lo invertira en su negocio de  forma que esto le permitira llevar el sustento a su hogar e  ir mejorando su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela Justina is an enterprising person. She owns a small shop, with more than five years of experience in this line of work. She is the mother of six children; they are now economically independent. Both she and her husband work in the shop. Gabriela works Monday to Sunday, from six in the morning until nine in the evening. Her customers are neighbors that live close to the shop.

She is requesting a loan in our institution to invest in working capital. She will buy supplies such as rice, sugar, oil and dairy products. Her intention is to have a wider variety of products, to be able to offer more items to her customers and to increase the number of customers. She invested the previous loan in her business. She bought more products for her shop.

She appreciates the opportunity and the confidence that CEPRODEL and Kiva have in her. She will invest this loan in her business, which will allow her to support her family and to improve more and more her life's condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, oil and dairy products.

loans.name: Robin Paul

texts.es:
Robin es un joven de 21 años de edad, de condición humilde pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad y junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para poder darle una vida digna llena de amor y de lucha. Robín es una persona a la que en Perú le llamamos mil oficios ya que el sabe hacer de todo ya sea trabajos de electricidad, gasfitería, pintado, entre otros, por ello en su barrio es muy conocido, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Robin logro comprar 2 parlantes y con ello inicio su negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonido, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 5 horas los fines de semana, ya que  en los demás días trabaja realizando varios oficios; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismático y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Robin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar plásticos para poder cubrir el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente por motivo de las lluvias el agua ingresa a su vivienda por el techo el cual tiene agujeros, de esta manera podrá evitar que sus pocas pertenencias se malogren por el agua y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Robin, 21, lives in humble circumstances but is very determined to get ahead, especially since he is the father of a 2-year-old son; and he and his wife work very hard to give him a decent life full of love and determination.  Robin is someone who in Perú is called "mil oficios" (Jack of all trades), since he knows how to do everything from electricity, to gas fitting, to painting, etc.  Therefore, in his neighborhood he is very well-known.  With a lot of effort and savings, Robin was able to buy two loudspeakers and start his business renting sound equipment.  He spends about five hours with this business on weekends, because the rest of the week he works doing other things.  He believes business is going well because he is kind to the customers, especially because he is charismatic and very determined to get ahead.

Robin is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he is able to buy plastic to fix the roof of his house, which is currently suffering from water leakage when it rains.  By covering the holes he will avoid water damage in the house and be able to work every day toward his goal: "To finish building his house with solid materials and give his son a good education".

loans.use: To buy materials to fix his roof.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia se4 sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y negocio de crianza de animales y tambien tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende arroz,azucar,leche y los animales los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia ya tiene 5 años en estos peuqeños negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita le credito para comprar chanchos,gallinas y cuyes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
The member continues in her agriculture business and raising animals.  She also has a small grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, and milk.  She fattens the animals to sell them later at different markets.  She has been in business for five years and her goal is to has an establishment where she can sell her animals.  She is requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.
