The member is grateful for this loan and committed to paying it back on time as with previous loans.

loans.use: To buy pigs,chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS,el socio sigue con su negocio de venta de cigarrillos ,el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su mama,el socio reparte su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan como en las ciudades de Ayacucho,Andahuaylas y otros clientes que le solicitan,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa privada siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de cigarrillos para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank CAMINEMOS JUNTOS and is still in business selling cigarettes.  He works with his mother and sells goods to customers in the cities of Ayacucho, Andahuaylas and to other customers who order.  He has been in business for several years and, thanks to the hard work he puts into it daily, it is going well.  He also is still working for a private company, and is able to support his family with this lifestyle.

He is requesting a loan to buy cigarettes for his business.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes for his business.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras,la socia vende zanahorias,zapallos,tomates y pepinos,la socia las verduras lo vende en los mercados,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos,vacas y pollos,ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zanahorias,tomates,zapallos y pepinos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
The borrower continues working in her vegetable sales business. She sells carrots, pumpkins, tomatoes and cucumbers. She sells the vegetables in the markets. She also has a business raising animals such as pigs, cows and chickens. She fattens them and then sells them in various market places. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell vegetables. She is asking for a loan to buy carrots, pumpkins, tomatoes and cucumbers.

The borrower is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to repay it punctually as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetable seeds and also vitamins for her double breasted chickens.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa tiene tres hijas en edad escolar, es una persona esforzada con muchos deseos de superación; de oficio pequeña comerciante que se dedica a vender granos básicos y algunos alimentos necesarios en la dieta de los nicaragüenses, ella vive en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, un lugar ubicado al suroeste de Managua, capital de Nicaragua a cincuenta minutos de viaje.
Antes de tener  esta actividad comercial, ella se dedicaba a producir tortillas y poco a poco gracias a sus esfuerzos y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida; fue  ahorrarando  y es como logro tener esta nueva actividad.

El crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL, lo utilizara para compra de: mercadería  de consumo: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, y verduras. con lo que espera en mejorar la atención a sus clientes y la de su familia.
 
Agradece a KIVA y ceprodel por la oportunidad de crédito que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Tomasa has three school aged daughters. She is a hardworking person who really wants to get ahead. She is a small businesswoman who sells basic grains and some other foods necessary to the Nicaraguan diet. She lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur, an area located southwest of Managua, the capital de Nicaragua, which is fifty minutes away. 
 
Before having this commercial activity, she produced tortillas. Little by little, with help from her life's companion, she saved up and was able to start this new activity.

The loan she is asking CEPRODEL for will be used to buy food merchandise such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and vegetables. She hopes to improve service to her customers and her family. 
 
She is grateful to KIVA and Ceprodel for any loan opportunity they can offer.

loans.use: to buy food merchandise such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,chanchos y ovejas,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia vende cereales como trigo y tarwi,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,chanchos y ovejas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This member is still raising animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and sheep. She is also a farmer and sells grains such as wheat and tarwi. She has done this activity for 5 years now. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and sheep. 

She is thankful for and values the loan given in this way and is committed to making her payments in a disciplined way, as she has done with previous loans.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Duterimbere I Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe Duterimbere I   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à  Jean,  un  commerçant de bière. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants qui étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de farine de manioc  depuis 19 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec pour préparer de la farine à  vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce  aux bénéfices de son commerce, Françoise habille, nourrit sa famille et paie les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Françoise is a member of the Duterimbere I group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and is married to Jean, a beer seller. The couple have 5 children who all got to school.

Françoise has been selling cassava flour for 19 years. This will be her 18th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will allow her to buy a large quantity of dry cassava to make into flour for resale, so that she can earn more money. Thanks to the profits from her business, Françoise can clothe and feed her family, and pay for her children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy dry cassava to make into flour for resale.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Maria Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS HIJAS DE MARIA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. María Mercedes ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de churros, tienda de abarrotes, librería, manualidades, venta de muebles, crianza de cuyes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LAS HIJAS DE MARIA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.

María Mercedes is 47, married and has 3 children. She alternates her family activities with her store. She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, snacks, sodas and more. She has been in this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She works at her business Monday through Sunday from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., approximately. This can vary according to the activities she may have on any day. She is a responsible and hardworking person and that is how she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business. She is in the inserted photo, and apologized for arriving at the meeting late. The other members' businesses are selling churros, a small grocery store, a bookstore, handmade crafts, selling furniture, and raising guinea pigs.

Maria Mercedes is thankful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Twubake Ii Group

texts.fr:
Vincent fait partie du groupe Twubake II  et habite à  Kayanza. Il a  32 ans et est marié à  Léonie, une  cultivatrice et   commerçante de légumes. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 2 à 6 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il  est éleveur et commerçant de  bière de sorgho depuis 6 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de sorgho pour préparer  beaucoup de litres de bière  à  vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des vaches pour consolider son élevage.
texts.en:
Vincent is a member of the Twubake II group and lives in Kayanza. He is 32 years old and is married to Léonie, a vegetable grower and seller. The couple have 3 children, aged between 2 and 6 years old, one of whom goes to school.

Vincent has been breeding livestock and selling sorghum beer for 6 years. This will be his second loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and allow him to buy a large quantity of sorghum with which to make many litres of beer for resale, so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to buy some cows to strengthen his breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sorghum, with which to make many litres of beer for resale.

loans.name: Michaelene

texts.en:
Michaelene is a 24-year-old married woman with one child. Michaelene has been in the business of hog-raising for five years. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. 

Each month Michaelene earns five thousand pesos by doing the hog raising business. In the future, Michaelene would like to expand her business in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Henry Ngugi

texts.en:
Henry used his previous loan well; he bought assorted clothes and the business improved greatly. He is taking his third loan from KADET Ltd. after serving the previous ones without any difficulty. He will use the loan to buy more stocks of new clothes to sell in the coming high season. 

He has never borrowed from another MFI, he has a good credit history with KADET Ltd. He hopes to become a leading boutique owner in the area, which will enable his family to live a happy life.

loans.use: To buy variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire sans enfant  de 23 ans, Mensah est un revendeur de téléphones portables et accessoires. Récemment lancé dans la vie active, il s’est intéressé à la maintenance et au commerce et s’y est complètement adonné en 2010.  Il sollicite son premier crédit auprès de  WAGES  pour payer des téléphones portables et accessoires et équiper sa boutique des nouveautés qui sont sur le marché. Il souhaite avoir plus d’équipement pour  la maintenance et aussi assurer l’éducation et le bien être sanitaire de son petit frère.
texts.en: A young, 23-year-old, single man, Mensah sells mobile phones and accessories. Recently starting his worklife, he became interested in maintenance and sales and has devoted himself to this line of work since 2010. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy some mobile phones and accessories, and to stock his shop up with the new products on the market. He would like to have more maintenance equipment and be able to provide for his younger brother's education and health care costs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband is a sales person in a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items, in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items, in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Future Group

texts.en:
Future group is made up of five women who are aged between 33 and 53 years. They sell items like provisions, maize, fish and eggs and have been meeting together in the same neighborhood for two years.

Happy is 54 years old. She is a provisions and maize (corn) seller who is single but has three daughters, all in school. They live together in a family house. She operates her business at her residence in a wooden structure. She sells from 7:30 am to 9:00 pm and business is good in its current location. This is her 5th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she is requesting 1,200 Ghana Cedi to buy more maize, potatoes, Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees and milk. She is standing at the back with a white sleeveless top in the photograph.

She was given a previous loan of 1,000 Ghana Cedi in her 4th loan cycle and she finished paying it back on the 25th of September 2012. After ten years working experience, she believes ID-Ghana loans are good, flexible and reliable for traders like her and her group members.

She is therefore focusing on her children education for now and taking on a building project on her own with the support of Kiva.

The group needs 3,950 Ghana Cedi to improve the standards of their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more maize, potatoes, Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees and milk.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Ms Nazir is a 43-year-old married woman. She has one buffalo in milk and has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. Her husband assists in selling milk door-to-door.  She has a good number of customers which are increasing gradually. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. 

She is a mother of one child. She lives in large conventional families with her husband, child, and other relatives. She requires earning more to cover everyday expenditures of her family members.  Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000.  She will be using the loan to buy one more buffalo to inflate sales. She expects an increase in her business income. She intends to utilize the earned profits on providing good and quality food to her family members.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 22-year-old single lady and she has four siblings. She is a university student majoring in Mathematics. She has applied for this loan to pay for the university fees and continue studying to get a bachelor degree.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha, a 38-year-old conservative woman, asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Maha is a mother to four children. One of them is Aya, who is a 21-year-old single lady who is attending the university to study financial economics. Now Maha wants to support her daughter, so she has applied for a loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is from a small village in the Baghdati district. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandsons (1, 3 and 4 years old). His economic activity is a greenhouse where different kinds of greens are grown. He owns a vineyard as well and picks the grapes in the late summer. He does all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. He produces vodka and wine and sells it in his village. He works hard to make some savings and expand his agricultural business. 

Teimuraz requested a loan to install an irrigation system in his greenhouse. After the greenhouse is properly watered, he will be able to harvest more greens and sell them at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Teimuraz will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales y agricultura,la socia cria chanchos,pollos y cuyes y en el negocio de agricultura la socia siembra maiz,papa y cebada,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia ya tiene 9 años en estos pequeños negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,chanchos y pollos y alimentos para los animales.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to work raising animals and growing crops. She raises pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs and she also grows corn, potatoes, and barley. Luz Marina has been working in agriculture for 7 years and it has gone very well for her. She has worked in small businesses for 9 years. Her dream is to have a fixed place where she can sell her animals. 

Luz Marina is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and animal feed. She is very grateful and values the loan. Luz Marina promises to be reliable and disciplined with repayments just as she has been with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and blessed with nine children, two of whom are below the age of 15. This lovely family lives in a four-room house at Mankon, Bamenda, in the Northwest Region of Cameron.

She has faced many difficulties in her life such as insufficient capital farm inputs, illiteracy, ill health, problems with neighbors and many more. However, there was light at the end of the tunnel when she joined GHAPE. She will be using this loan to buy more crates, day old chicks, feed trays, medical needs of the chicks, drinkers and poultry farm preparation.

The activity will help the community to increase their protein intake through available and affordable chicken, and also manure for farmers around. She will succeed because of her longevity in poultry farming and the high demand for her products, especially as festivity periods are approaching.

Her profits will be used to improve the standard of living of her family, especially education, nutrition and healthcare. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the gradual installment payments and the training on finance management given by GHAPE staff.

loans.use: to pay for one day old chicks and feed.

loans.name: Tisalia

texts.es:
La socia Tisalia tiene 22 años de edad,es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria chanchos,cuyes y pollos,ella los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien estudia contabilidad,la socia quiere salir adelante y ser profesional,la socia al negocio de crianza de animales se dedica 5 años,el sueño de la socis es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,chanchos y pollos.

La socia esta agradecida con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member Tisalia is twenty-two years old.  She lives with her partner and has one son.  She makes a living raising animals, like pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She makes them grow and fatten, and then sells them at different fairs.

This member also studies accounting.  She wants to move forward and become a professional.  

She has been raising animals for five years.  Her dream is to have her own place where she can sell the animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens.

This member is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Jeune revendeur d’accessoires de téléphones portables, Komla est un célibataire sans enfant de 23 ans. Il possède une boutique où il assure la distribution de ses produits. Très tôt en 2007 il s’engagea dans cette activité mais rencontre actuellement des difficultés de rupture de stock. Il est actuellement à son troisième  crédit  qu’il sollicite auprès de WAGES pour payer des accessoires de téléphones portables. Il veut contribuer à l’éducation de ses frères et sœurs et  rêve de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
A young reseller of mobile phones and accessories, Komla is a 23-year-old bachelor with no children. He has a shop where he distributes his products.

He began the business in early 2007, but is currently facing problems with depletion of his stock. He is currently requesting his third loan from WAGES in order to purchase mobile phone accessories.

Komla wants to contribute to the education of his brothers and sisters, and dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar, an 18-year-old single lady, has just enrolled herself in the university to study nursing. She has applied for an education loan so she can complete paying for her registration and semester fees.

loans.use: complete paying for her registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Afiavi est une revendeuse de produit d’alimentation générale dans une boutique sise à son domicile à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés et respectivement âgé de 20, 18 et 10 ans. Âgée de 48 ans, elle a commencé cette activité génératrice de revenu en 2009. Elle sollicite pour une seconde fois, un prêt auprès de WAGES pour renforcer son stock de marchandise. Elle envisage ouvrir une seconde boutique et conquérir de nouveaux marchés.
texts.en:
Afiavi is a reseller of general food products in a shop located at her home in Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school, ages 20, 18, and 10. 

Afiavi is 48 years old and began this general revenue-generating activity in 2009. She is requesting a loan from WAGES for the second time in order to be able to replenish her stock of merchandise. Afiavi hopes to open a second shop and conquer new markets.

loans.use: to purchase general food products

loans.name: Elisabeth Mantan

texts.en:
Elisabeth is a widow with five children, and they live in a four-room apartment in Azire Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, which include the death of her husband and other family members, accidents faced by family members, one of her family members having HIV/AIDS, theft and poverty.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2006 and has taken and repaid her empowerment credit four times, with the most recent loan amount being 250,000 frs, and she says if given the new loan requested, she will expand her foodstuff retail store at the Bamenda food market where she sells onions, maize, and other basic commodities. She is very positive her business will succeed because she has regular customers, she has a good business site, and also because other GHAPE members are always buying from her to patronize her. From this business she says the community will benefit from regular supply and low prices.

With the profit from the loan she promises to educate her children, provide medication, pay other dues like electricity bills and food bills, and also to provide medication for her family in case of ill health. She also says she prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, education before loan disbursement, its help in the fight against HIV/AIDS, and also because the loans given by GHAPE are paid conveniently.

loans.use: to pay for corn and onions and to do some repairs in her store.

loans.name: Rowema

texts.en:
Rowema is 32 years old, and she lives together with her friend in West Point. She has three children between the ages of 1 and 12 who are in school. 

Rowema has been selling palm oil for the past three years. She received help from her friend to start this business and learned to sell from her mother.  One challenge she faces is the rise and fall of prices on the market. 

Rowema has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil to increase her sales. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married with seven children, two of whom are below the age of 15 years. They live in a four-room apartment at Nkwen Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life which include ill health within her family, and also theft and fighting over property by her family members.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2003 and has taken and repaid her empowerment credit four times with the recent loan amount being 200,000frs. She says if given the new loan requested, she will expand her fuel wood business, improve her farm garden and raise pigs. She is very positive that her business will succeed because she has regular customers, she has a good business site, and also other GHAPE members are always buying from her to patronize her. From this business she says the community will benefit from regular supply, as well as low prices of firewood, vegetables and pork.

With the profit from the loan she promises to educate her children, provide medication, and to plow back some of the profit into her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, education before loan disbursement, its help in the fight against HIV/AIDS, and also because the loans given by GHAPE are paid conveniently.

loans.use: to pay for fuel wood and seedlings.

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es:
El señor Arnoldo es originario de la ciudad de Valle hermoso, Tamaulipas, pero radico en esta ciudad desde hace más de 40 años. Actualmente se encuentra separado de su esposa, pero tiene contacto con sus hijos a quienes apoya económicamente. El señor Arnoldo se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a la reparación de vehículos en lo que se refiere a lo eléctrico, cuenta con un taller que esta en su propiedad y también hay mismo tiene su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de herramienta más moderna y de mejora calidad y que esta reparando carros muy modernos que necesitan otro tipo de herramienta.
Desea mejorar la calidad de servicio y que sus clientes no busquen otro lugar donde les arreglen sus autos y que sigan dando el sus servicios de electrónica automotriz.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is originally from the city of Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, but he's lived in Nuevo Laredo more than 40 years. He and his wife have separated, but he is in touch with his children, whom he supports financially. Arnoldo has been working on automotive electrical systems for more than 20 years. He has a workshop on the property where his house is located.
He is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing more modern tools of better quality. He is repairing newer cars now, which require other types of tools.
Arnoldo would like to improve the quality of his service so his customers keep coming to him don't go elsewhere to get their cars fixed.

loans.use: to buy tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Âgée de 52 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont trois scolarisés, Amavi est une revendeuse de  jus de fruit et d’huile rouge à son domicile. Son ainé a 30 ans et le tout dernier  a 14 ans.  Notons qu’elle pratique cette activité depuis 1990. Elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en huile rouge et de jus. Elle projette de s’acheter un véhicule de transport de bagages pour acheminer les marchandises depuis le lieu de ravitaillement jusqu'à son domicile.
texts.en:
52 years old and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom attend school, Amavi reslls fruit juice and red oil out of her home. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 14. 

Amavi has been in this business since 1990. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to stock up on red oil and juice. She plans on purchasing a transport vehicle to be able to bring the merchandise from its supply location all the way to her home.

loans.use: to purchase oil and the ingredients necessary for the preparation of juice

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 22-years-old single lady. She is one of eight siblings in the family.
 
Khitam is a university student majoring in economics. She wants to graduate as soon as possible and work in the field. She has applied for this loan in order to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Détaillant de produits congelés, Yawo est un célibataire sans enfant de 28 ans. Il a démarré ce commerce en 2010 et possède une boutique dont il est le seul gérant. Il poursuit ardemment, pendant qu’il se prépare à fonder une famille, son but de devenir d’ici peu, un semi grossiste. Il sollicite donc son quatrième crédit auprès de WAGES  pour acheter des produits congelés et agrandir ainsi son commerce.
texts.en:
Yawo is 28 years old, single, and has no children. He is a retailer of frozen food products.

He started his business in 2010 and has a shop that he manages by himself. As he prepares to start a family, he is ardently striving to achieve his goal of becoming a semi-wholesaler in the near future.

He is seeking his fourth loan from WAGES to buy frozen food products and, in doing so, expand his business.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 48 years old and lives in Jacob Town with her two children, aged 28 and 33. They attend school and are living on their own. She is married and her husband works as an office assistant. 

For the past two years she has been selling charcoal, lappa (Traditional cloth) and necklaces in the local market. She makes a good profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, lappa, and necklaces for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, lappa, and necklaces for her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 35-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. He has two children.

He requested a 1,500 JOD loan to pay for construction supplies to resell at retail. Omar wants to expand his business and in the future he is looking forward to increasing his income and improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella, 33, who stopped her education in the ninth grade, is single with a child that is six years old, and lives at West Point. Her child is attending school. 

Bella has a table in the market where she has been selling used clothes for the past three years. She sells ladies' blouses and men's shirts. Because of the good quality material that she sells, she makes a profit, with which she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en:
Shamila is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 15. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs four staff members. Her business is located within a productive agricultural area and her primary customers are traders from the nearby market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor road network to the market area. 

She will use the 5,800 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to purchase a solar lantern which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to employ equipment having modern technology on her farm within five years. Shamila also runs a retail store which adds to her business income. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her retail store business and improve on farm production.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married with five children, two of whom are below the age of 15 years. They live in a three-room apartment at Mankon Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life which include the drowning of her child, sickness among her family members and an attempt by her husband to bring a second wife.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2009 and has taken and repaid her empowerment credit two times, with the recent loan amount being 100,000frs. She says if given the new loan requested, she will expand her restaurant with the buying of more koki beans and palm oil. She will also buy more fowl and pigs and feed for them. She is very positive her business will succeed because she has regular customers, she has a good business site, and also other GHAPE members are always buying from her to patronize her. From this business she says the community will benefit from regular supply, low prices and manure for farmers.

With the profit from the loan she promises to educate her children, provide medication, and to plow back some of the profit into her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, education before loan disbursement, its help in the fight against HIV/AIDS, and also because the loans given by GHAPE are paid conveniently.

loans.use: to pay for koki beans, palm oil, fowl and pigs.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Nora del Carmen es comerciante tiene un tramo en uno de los  mercados de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua, su actividad es venta de productos artesanales como: maseteras de barro, alcansillas de barro, comales de barro de tres tamaños y productos plásticos como: barriles, Valdés, alcancilla plásticas, panas, vasos y arreglo florales artificiales. 

Es casada su esposo es mecánico tiene un taller propio en su casa, trabaja con un hijo que es mecánico. 
Doña Nora tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, son casados, una hija es la que vive con ella es casada y tiene dos hijos menores y es la que le ayuda en el mercado a atender a su clientela y hacer las piñatas y los arreglos florales.
 los créditos anteriores los ha invertido en su negocio.este que esta solicitando lo invertira en compra de mercadería artesanal: Comales de barro, maseteras de barro y plásticas, jarrones de barro para flores.para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Este cliente manifestó sentirse muy contenta con los crédito que Ceprodel y kiva le han financiado y asi su negocio ha tenido un crecimiento poco a poco y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
texts.en:
Nora del Carmen is a businesswoman who has stalls in one of the markets located in San Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua. There she sells artesanal products such as clay pots, and clay collection boxes, three sizes of ceramic hotplates, and plastic barrels, buckets, collection boxes, vases and artificial flower arrangements.

Nora del Carmen is married. Her husband is a mechanic and runs a small repair shop out of their house. He works with his son, who is also a mechanic.  
Nora del Carmen has four children who are older and married. One daughter, her husband, and their two children live with Nora del Carmen and her husband. This daughter helps her mother to sell goods in the market as well as make piñatas and flower arrangements.

Nora del Carmen has invested previous loans in her business and with this one she plans to buy craft materials such as ceramic hotplates, clay pots, plastic pots, and clay vases for flowers in order to offer a wider variety of merchandise to her customers. She has been very happy with the previous loans she requested from Ceprodel and Kiva. She has been able to slowly expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy craft materials such as blocks of clay, clay and plastic pots, and clay vases for flowers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from four years to 20 years. He describes himself to be a hard-working man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from the customers sometimes. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy fabric for making new clothes for selling. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will cater for his family financial needs as he is the provider (bread winner) of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes for selling

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 38-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of three children. 

She has been running a hotel (a very basic restaurant) for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 16,700, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Winfred will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar and food. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar and other food.

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en:
Evodia is married and a mother of five with two children below the ages of fifteen; they live in a-seven room apartment in Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon. 

She has faced many challenges in life, such as the death of a cousin, inadequate capital to start up a business, and the inability to afford education for the family. She intends to use this loan to increase her poultry farming activity by buying more birds, feeders, and feed. She will also buy koki beans and oil for the cooking of koki, and part of the loan will be use to purchase piglets. 

This activity will help the community by providing quality poultry to the public; it will also enable the population to enjoy good quality koki and pork meat. She believes the business will succeed because of the high demand for fowl and ever-increasing demand for koki in the community. Also her longevity in the above activity is a reason for her to believe that the business will succeed. 

With the profit from the loan she will sponsor the children in school, increase her business, and pay for the healthcare of the family. Generally the living standards of the family will be increased. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rate, education before loan disbursement, and also the loans given by GHAPE are paid conveniently.

loans.use: to pay for fowl, piglets and koki beans

loans.name: Al-Afrah Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Afrah, consists of four members who are three women and one man. They are from Aden, Yemen. All their projects are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. This group took a loan of 320,000 YER. 

Amal is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Aden. She’s affectionately a part of this group and she says that she’s very happy because her business has improved little by little. 

She has been distributing mobile phones and mobile recharge cards. She started the business because she wanted to help her family with their children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. She loves her work and aspires to continue to get more profit. For this reason, she’s asking for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to continue buying mobiles and recharge cards that will help her to get more profit from her business. She dreams of opening an electronics shop.

loans.use: to continue buying mobile phones and recharge cards.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! La Sra. Presentación es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, un grupo conformado por 5 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Presentación se dedica a la venta ambulante de frutas como chirimoya, tumbo, tuna y berenjena – todo frutas que son buenas para el hígado. En invierno, ella también se dedica a la venta de mazamorra de calabaza, en su propia casa.

Presentación ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar más frutas. Su sueño es un día tener un puesto propio en el mercado, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Presentación es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Presentación ha logrado pagar los estudios de sus hijos en la universidad y comprarles una computadora. Presentación está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú!  Presentación is a member of the ‘Mujeres Emprendedoras’ [Enterprising Women] communal bank.  The bank is comprised of five members who have different business activities.

Presentación sells fruit in an itinerant manner.  She sells things  like custard apples, banana passion fruit, prickly pear, and eggplant, all fruits that are good for the liver.  In winter she also sells pumpkin pudding at her house.

Presentación has requested the loan to buy more fruit.  Her dream is to one day have her own stand at the market.  This way she would be better able to tend to her customers.

Presentación is married and has three children.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, Presentación has managed to pay for her children’s university education, and she has managed to buy them a computer.  Presentación is very happy with this loan, and she is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a widow with six children, two of whom are under 15 years of age. She and her family live in a four-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. She has encountered many difficulties in life, including the death of two of her children, her husband and her brother.  She lacks the capital needed to open a larger business, but is applying for a loan to buy Irish potatoes in bags as well as beans, corn and piglets. She will also use part of the loan to paid the rent on her market stall. This will allow her to provide good-quality food at affordable prices to people who live in her community, and help them get this produce locally rather than by traveling a long distance. She believes her business will succeed because of the high demand for food in her community. Francisca will use the profits she earns from this loan to provide her children with medical care, and also to improve her family's living standards. She likes doing business with GHAPE because it provides loans at low interest rates, provides education before disbursing loans, and also has convenient payback terms.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, beans, corn and piglets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 2 and 4. She describes herself as social. She operates a tailoring retail store  where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located within a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Josephine says her biggest business challenge is inadequate stock that she can sell to customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to enlarge her business within five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 35, is single with a 5-year-old child and lives in West Point. Hawa has been involved in used clothing sales for the past five years. She sells children's clothes--both boys and girls. She learned to sell from her mother. She is proud of this business because she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit that is generated from the business, she attends to the needs of her child and improves her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. Her plan is to give her child better education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mariano Antonio

texts.es:
Mariano, está decidido por continuar trabajando a través de préstamos, ya que se le presentan oportunidades para poder invertir y continuar realizando el trabajo agrícola, él está iniciando la siembra de maíz para lo cual necesita invertir en la compra de abono, semilla, pago de mano de obra para preparar el terreno, ya que es lo necesario para que realice su trabajo.

Con el credito anterior el logró realizar una buena labor con su esposa ya que compro todos los materiales necesarios para la elaboracion del pan, le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos, su situación económica de la familia considera que están mejorando con relación al préstamo anterior.
texts.en:
Mariano is determined to continue working via loans.  They present opportunities to be able to invest and to continue doing agricultural work.  He is starting to plant corn for which he needs to buy fertilizer and seeds.  He also needs to pay for the labor to prepare the land because this needs to be done in order to do his work.

With the previous loan he and his wife managed to do good work.  This is because he bought all of the materials needed to make bread.  This has allowed him to have greater income.  He feels that his family’s financial situation is improving, which is related to the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 36, lives in West Point with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 15. 

Sarah has a table in the market where she has sold rice, flour, cooking oil, butter, baking powder and sugar for the past three years. Her husband gave her the initial capital to start this business. She makes a profit when she sells because of the position of her table; customers stop to buy as they pass through the market.  

Sarah is requesting this loan to purchase more flour, cooking oil, butter and baking powder to increase her sales. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, cooking oil, butter and baking powder to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ghada Group

texts.en: Ghada group consists of four women who are friends from the same village. They live in Aden, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 320,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the member's activity level. Zmzm is the leader of the group. She is 25 years old. She has been selling clothes in her own region for three years. She has requested a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics in one of the regions of Aden in order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics for her business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience, 31, is married and live in West Point with her two children, who are 4 and 9 and are currently in school.  For the past six years, she has been selling rice, pepper, onions, vita, palm oil, black pepper, tomatoes, and many other items.  She started this business with 6,000 Liberian Dollars that she had saved in a saving club. She loves to do this business because it help her in supporting her children. She has requested this loan to purchase more pepper, rice, onions, vita, and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to buy land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, onions, vita, and palm oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José solicita el préstamo para realizar unos mejoramientos en su vivienda, es la instalación del cableado de eléctrico y la elaboración de la barda alrededor de su casa, ya que por seguridad de su familia y protección de algún accidente que se puede ocasionar.
El señor José es empleado de una fabrica en el aria de producción, tiene ya mas de once años trabajando para esta compañía, su esposa le ayuda en la económicamente vendiendo tacos afuera de su casa por las mañana. Tiene tres hijos de edad escolar a quienes les desean dar lo mejor y que sean unos triunfadores.
Solicitan el crédito para comprar el material ya que el señor José se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adiciones a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. José is applying for a loan in order to make some improvements on his home. He will install electrical wiring and build a fence around his house to keep his family safe and protect them from any incident that could occur.

Sr. José is employed at a factory and has spent more than eleven years working for the company. His wife helps out financially by selling tacos outside their house in the mornings. He has three school-aged children whom he wants to give the best and see succeed in life.

He is requesting the loan in order to buy materials and will be making the improvements himself while working full-time.

loans.use: to install electrical wiring and build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Patricia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Patricia, continúa realizando la venta de bolsones, mochilas, carteras, ropa variada y necesita por el momento capital de trabajo para poder dinamizar el negocio, a través de un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra de bolsones, mochilas carteras, en diferentes estilos y colores, dicha compra le permitirá continuar en la venta y poder mantener su trabajo del cual sostiene su hogar.

Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior permitió fortalecer el negocio, que hasta el momento sus ganancias han podido aumentar y ayudar a su familia, las condiciones en el hogar se mantiene permanentes.
texts.en:
Patricia continues selling hand bags, backpacks, purses, assorted clothes. At the moment, she needs working capital in order to make her business more dynamic, through a loan that would make it possible for her to buy hand bags, backpacks and purses in different colors and styles. Buying these items will make it possible for her to continue to sell and to keep her job, which is how she sustains her home.

She mentions that the previous loan made it possible to strengthen the business, that so far her profits have increased and she has been able to help her family. Her family's conditions continue to be stable.

loans.use: to buy hand bags, backpacks and purses.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is married and blessed with two children under age 15. They live in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, which is in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has encountered many challenges in life such as the death of a child, inadequate capital to start a business and the inability to pay for her children's education.

With this loan, Bright intends to increase her poultry farming activities by buying chicks and feed. She will also buy fuel wood and part of the loan will be used to purchase the needed vaccines for the poultry farm. These activities will help the community provide good quality fowls to the public. It will also enable the population to buy wood without having to travel long distances. She believes the business will succeed because of the high demand for poultry and the ever-increasing demand for fuel wood in the community. 

With the profit from the loan, Bright will take care of her house and increase her business. She will also be able to pay for healthcare for the family and improve their living standards. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and the education given before loan disbursement. Also, the loans given by GHAPE are paid conveniently.

loans.use: to pay for chicks, feed and fuel wood.

loans.name: M'banime

texts.fr: M’Banine est une jeune femme de 29 ans avec 02 enfants âgés respectivement de  04 et 02 ans. Après une formation de coiffure sanctionnée de diplôme, elle ouvre son  propre salon de coiffure en 2005 où elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Suite à son expérience de premier prêt, elle sollicite un second crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour améliorer les conditions de vies de ses enfants.
texts.en: M’Banine is a young 29 year old woman with 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old respectively. After training as a hairdresser and receiving her diploma, she opened her own salon in 2005 where she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. After her experience with her first loan, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics and hair extensions. She hopes to increase her turnover to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Adjélé

texts.fr: Veuve de 52 ans avec 04 enfants, Adjélé est une revendeuse de pagnes. Elle dispose d’un point de vente à son lieu de résidence et pratique cette activité depuis 1988. Elle sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour payer des pagnes afin d’aménager son domicile. Comme perspective d’avenir elle souhaite construire une boutique à son domicile et mieux prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en: A 52 year old widow with 4 children, Adjélé is a reseller of 'pagne' cloth. She sells from her home and has been practicing this business since 1988. She is requesting her third loan from WAGES to pay for 'pagne' cloth in order to set up her home. For the future she would like to build a shop at her home and better take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth.

loans.name: El Campo (Gandería) Group

texts.es:
"El Campo" (The Field in Spanish) is formed by 7 responsible and joyful women. They all are doing their best to offer their children better living conditions. They chose this name for the group because they gather in a soccer field to talk about matters related to their loan. The members shared that on weekends, the field is completely crowded with soccer followers. "El Campo" group is a very loyal one, whenever one of the members gets in trouble, all the other women try to help. 

Doña Celia is part of the group. She is 52 years old and she married Alfredo 40 years ago. They had a large family, but for the time being only one of thei sons is still depending on them. The child is attending junior high. "I run a small general store. My husband started it 35 years ago." The name of the store was actually chosen by one of the soda suppliers. Celia mentioned that her husband began the business because the family needed a source of income since Celia's husband did not have a job back then. They started selling candy right at their home, but then they invested and bought a larger land. Then, they started building the home and the establishment as well. "We have grown little by little. At the beginning we lived where there were no facilities and we did not have many customers." Now, Celia is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, canned tuna, sodas, and cleaning products to restock her store. The current challenge she has to face is that there are many other general stores around and she needs to have more products so that she does not lose her clients. "I don't want my store to stop because I still want to help my child with his studies. I want to help him make his dreams come true: he wants to be a radio announcer just like his older brother."

All the members of the group are happy and grateful for the loan. They will all invest in their activities. Rosa, Leticia and María Guadalupe will buy sheep to raise them. Josefina will buy pigs. Zenaida will buy school supplies for her stationery store. Esperanza will buy pigs to raise them too.
texts.en:
"El Campo" (The Field in Spanish) is formed by 7 responsible and joyful women. They all are doing their best to offer their children better living conditions. They chose this name for the group because they gather in a soccer field to talk about matters related to their loan. The members shared that on weekends, the field is completely crowded with soccer followers. "El Campo" group is a very loyal one, whenever one of the members gets in trouble, all the other women try to help. 

Doña Celia is part of the group. She is 52 years old and she married Alfredo 40 years ago. They had a large family, but for the time being only one of  their sons is still depending on them. The child is attending junior high. "I run a small general store. My husband started it 35 years ago." The name of the store was actually chosen by a soda supplier. Celia mentioned that her husband began the business because the family needed a source of income since Celia's husband did not have a job back then. They started selling candy right at their home, but then they invested and bought a larger land. Then, they started building the home and the establishment as well. "We have grown little by little. At the beginning we lived where there were no facilities and we did not have many customers." Now, Celia is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, canned tune, sodas, and cleaning products to restock her store. The current challenge she has to face is that there are many other general stores around and she needs to have more products so that she does not lose her clients. "I don't want my store to stop because I still want to help my child with his studies. I want to help him make his dreams come true: he wants to be a radio announcer just like his older brother."

All the members of the group are happy and grateful for the loan. They will all invest in their activities. Rosa, Leticia and María Guadalupe will buy sheep to raise them. Josefina will buy pigs. Zenaida will buy school supplies for her stationery store. Esperanza will buy pigs to raise them too.

loans.use: To buy milk, sodas, sugar, beans, detergent, bread, eggs, etc.

location.town: Monte Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, 47, stopped her education in the 8th grade. She has three children that are between the ages of 8 and 23, and are currently in school.  

For the past four years, she has been selling charcoal in the community. She makes a profit when she sells since she is the only one who sells coal on a retail basis in her community. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more charcoal bags to sell retail. Her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal bags to sell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha se dedica arduamente a la labor de maestro de primaria de un colegio de la localidad, con 22 años de laborar, es soltera tiene 1 hija a su cargo la cual le está brindando  todo el apoyo para que se prepare académicamente a nivel universitario.
 
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Martha atraviesa es de continuar mejorando su negocio ya que además de ser maestra también viaja a costa rica los fines de semana para desarrollar su negocio, como  otra fuente de ingreso la que ha ejercido por varios años combinando las 2 actividades  y de esa manera ha venido apoyando a su hija.  Por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Oro Laminado, Plata, Cocina, Cosimey, Licuadora y Microonda, para incrementar el inventario de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida. 

Agradece de antemano a KIVA y CEPRODLE por el apoyo que le puedan brindar por medio de este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has been a hardworking primary school teacher in her community for 22 years. She is single and has a daughter dependent on her whom she is helping to prepare academically for the university.

One of Martha’s needs is to continue improving her business because, in addition to being a teacher, she also travels to Costa Rica on weekends to develop her business, which is another source of income that she has had for several years. By combining the two jobs in this way she has been supporting her daughter. Thus she has decided to come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy silverware, kitchenware, a blender and microwave in order expand her business inventory and improve her living standards.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel in advance for the support they are providing her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy silverware, kitchenware, blenders and microwaves, items ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Las Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es otro de los miembros de este grupo tiene la edad de 72 años, solo estudio primaria ya que cuando ella era pequeña los padres preferian enseñar a sus hijas las labores del hogar y dar estudios a los varones,es soltera y tuvo dos hijos los cuales ya estan casados. ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 8 meses abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da la caretera para poder ganar un poco de dinero extra para salir adelante, Doña Franciasca es una señora muy alegre y entusiasta y nos dice que tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, ella ademas de tener su tienda de abarrotes vende comida a los viajeros que se lo piden y asi puede tener mas entradas de dinero para seguir ayudandose. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de galletas, dulces, refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higienico, sal, harinas, cerillos y jabon para resurtir su tienda ademas de un poco de insumos chiles, tomates, cebollas y carne para la preparacion de su comida. ella nos dice que espera que Dios le continue prestando vida para continuar trabajando y salir adelante.

Las demas integrantes del grupo son:
Reyna -  Cafe internet
Loyda - carpinteria
Adilene - calzado
Maria Cohinta - ropa
Victoria - reposteria
Maria Concepcion - abarrotes
Carmela - antojitos
Matilde - perfumeria 
Luz del Carmen - refrescos
Cecilia - antojitos
Iris del Carmen - ropa
Juana - ropa
Isabel - abarrotes
texts.en:
Francisca is another of the members of this group.  She is 72 years old and she only has a primary education, as when she was young her parents thought it best to teach their daughters domestic work and send the boys to school.  She is single and she had two children, who are now married.  She tells us that a little over eight months ago she opened a small grocery store in the front part of her house, which faces the street, so she could earn a little extra money to get ahead.  Francisca is a very cheerful and enthusiastic woman and she tells us that she really wants to work and get ahead.  In addition to her grocery store, she sells prepared food to the passers-by who order from her and this allows her to have more money coming in so that she can keep taking care of herself.  She needs this loan to invest in cookies, candy, soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, salt, flours, matches, and soap to restock her store, as well as a few supplies, such as chilies, tomatoes, onions, and meat to make her prepared foods.  She tells us that she hopes God will continue to grant her life so that she can keep working and get ahead.

The other members of the group are:
Reyna- Internet cafe
Loyda- Carpentry
Adilene- Shoes
Victoria- Confectionery
Maria Concepcion- Groceries
Carmela- Snacks
Matilde- Perfumes
Luz del Carmen- Sodas
Cecilia- Snacks
Iris del Carmen- Clothing
Juana- Clothing
Isabel- Groceries

loans.use: to invest in her store and buy cookies, sweets, sodas, juices, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, salt, flour, matches, soap, peppers, tomatoes, onions and meat

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, continúa trabajando desde su hogar con los pequeños negocios que administra, ella solicita nuevamente un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de leña, harina, maíz, también invertirán parte en ropa variada para adultos y niños, como una alternativa para seguir realizando el comercio y generar ganancias para el hogar.

El préstamo anterior manifiesta que le permitió crecer en el negocio y poder competir con más productos, como la ropa variada, ella manifiesta que estos préstamos son los que le han permitido que ella continúe ayudando a su familia y que también le ha ayudado en la venta.
texts.en:
María continues working from her home at the small businesses she runs. She is requesting a new loan she will use to purchase firewood, flour and corn and also clothing for adults and children. Thus she will be able to continue with her two businesses and generate an income for her household.

The previous loan enabled her to expand her businesses and compete by having more products to offer, such as a variety of clothes. She says that the loans have allowed her to continue helping her family and they have also improved sales.

loans.use: to buy firewood, flour and corn.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano, 43, is married, has six children and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.
For seven years, Ponciano has been a farmer, growing vegetable crops to earn a living. Ponciano has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer.
Ponciano has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ponciano hopes to improve this family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Confianza Y Dignidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Eridania is a member of the Confianza y Dignidad (Truth and Dignity) 1 loan group. The members of this group are micro-entrepreneurs who make a living by selling clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. They sell their items in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the country's northeast.

She lives in a simple home with her long-term partner and their two children. Her most difficult challenges have been to establish her business and get new customers. From the beginning, it was very hard for her because she need to do business outside of her community, in a village that produces cacao, to do her milling there

Eridania is very excited about receiving her eighth loan from Esperanza Internacional, and has repaid her previous loans satisfactorily after using them to expand her business. She has had her business for about six years, and has been taking out loans from Esperanza for about four years. She will use this new loan to buy more cacao and equipment that will allow her to produce more milled cocoa. She will reinvest the profits in her business and set aside some money as savings. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cacao to mill and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 3 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is one of the members of the Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) 3 group. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country. They are micro entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. Luisa lives in a simple home structure with her husband and with one of their two children. She says her most difficult challenge has been to rebuild her house. She enjoys to read and stay at home with her family. 

Luisa is very excited about receiving her 12th loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’s growth. She started her business with the first loan she took from Esperanza. She has been taking out loans from Esperanza for about six years. She runs a beauty salon and for two years she has also been selling through a catalog one of the leading brands of natural medicine. She will use profits to reinvest in her businesses and to save for her family needs, like to finish building her home with a safer structure. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his bathroom.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nkubonage est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire « Baraka Alanine »,  âgée d’environ 40 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un chauffeur mécanicien indépendant. La cliente est vendeuse des articles divers au marché de Katindo.  Il ya 4 ans révolus, elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les habits à revendre (10 bodys, 10 jupes, 10 écharpes foulards, 6 boubous). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de BAC +5.  La cliente  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client Nkubonage is an entrepreneur, adviser to the group "Baraka Alanine", about 40 years old, married and mother to 8 children. Her husband is an independent driver mechanic. The client sells diverse items at the Katindo market. She has been practicing this business for 4 years. She started her business with her own money received from her husband. This new loan will serve to stock up in outfits to resell (10 leotards, 10 skirts, 10 scarves, 6 'boubous'). In addition, she aims to expand her business, and school her children up to the level of BAC +5. The client thanks Hekima for its actions to help poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy outfits to resell (10 leotards, 10 skirts, 10 scarves, 6 'boubous').

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela tiene 20 años soltera  se dedica  a la   venta de ropa según la temporada, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de las ferias más concurridas de la ciudad de El Alto  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gabriela va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor como ser poleras y blusas ya que se acerca la época de calor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, Gabriela va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, Gabriela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta actividad le permite mantenerse económicamente.
texts.en: Gabriela, 20, works selling seasonal clothing; she has a stand in one of the city of El Alto’s busiest street markets where she sells her wares.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Gabriela will use it to buy seasonal clothes like t-shirts and blouses since the hot weather season is approaching; this way she’ll have a variety of clothes available for her customers and profits will increase.  The reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business.  Gabriela will use the benefits to continue buying a variety of clothes according to the season.  Gabriela is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity provided because this activity makes it possible for her to support herself economically.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es: El grupo de la Cabañita esta conformado por 12 integrantes todas ellas mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras por tener una mejor calidad de vida, doña Liliana la cual tiene 29 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad llamada San Andrés, ella le ayuda a su esposo en un taller mecánico en lo que puede y en lo que él le enseña, dice que tienen con su negocio desde hace mas de 6 años y dice que emprendió su negocio por la falta de refaccionarias cerca de su comunidad y por eso ella decidió poner una refaccionaria donde su marido o mecánicos de la comunidad vengan a comprarle lo que ocupan para arreglar los vehículos, dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que esta al pendiente de sus dos hijos y de su negocio, es por eso que ella está pidiendo un crédito a Vision Fund para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de Refacciones para automóviles de diferentes marcas. Dice que su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y poner una refaccionaria en una población mas grande y que este cerca de una carretera. Los demás integrantes se llaman Consuelo, Leticia, Florentina, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Reynalda, Sofia y Alejandra ellas invertirán en cosméticos y perfumería por catalogo, en insumos para una panadería, en artículos para una tienda de abarrotes, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en zapatos y ropa por catalogo para su venta.
texts.en: The Cabañita group is made up of 12 members; all hardworking women who struggle to have a better quality of life.  Liliana is 29 years old and is originally from a community called San Andrés.  She and her husband have a mechanic workshop.  She helps him however she can and in whatever he can teach her.  She says that she’s had the business for more than six years and that they started it due to lack of auto parts in her community.  She and her husband decided to open a shop so that other mechanics could come and buy what they needed to fix cars.  She says that she really likes her work and that she watches over her two children and the business.  She is requesting a loan through Vision Fund so that she can continue to invest in her auto parts business and have different brand parts.  She says that her goal is to grow her business and open a parts store in a larger community, closer to the road.  The other members are llaman Consuelo, Leticia, Florentina, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Reynalda, Sofia and Alejandra, and they will invest in cosmetics and perfumes via catalog, baking supplies, products for a grocery store,  seasonal fruits and vegetables, and shoes and clothing via catalog.

loans.use: para la compra de diferentes refacciones para la compostura de automoviles

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina, 55, is married, has six children and lives in Balangasan Pagadian City. 

Martina has a general (sari-sari) store and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to renovate her house.

Martina has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to acquire a loan to renovate her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jardines Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
Brenda tiene la edad de 30 años, solo estudio la secundaria y es soltera, ella platica que hace tres años decidió emprender su propio negocio para ganar un poco mas de dinero y poder contribuir con el gasto de su hogar, así que  inicio a vender zapatos por catalogo  con sus amigos y vecinos, ella poco a poco a ganado mas clientes e incluso sale a vender a comunidades cercanas, sus ventas son sobre pedidos, ella sale por las tardes amostrar su catálogos para que sus clientes escogen los que mas les gusten  y cuando ya tiene varios pedidos los surte y entrega. Ella esta contenta porque este negocio no solo le ha dado la oportunidad de ganar dinero sino también de conocer gente  hacer nuevas amistades, ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de zapatos y catálogos para continuar con sus ventas, Branda espera que con esta inversión sus ganancias aumenten y a futuro le gustaría poder establecerse en un local al cual sus clientes acudan a comprar sus zapatos.

Brenda es miembro de un grupo llamado Jardines del Bosque el cual esta integrado por 7 personas, ellos decidieron poner este nombre al grupo porque es el nombre del lugar donde viven, los demás integrantes son: Verónica venta de antojitos, Silvestra venta de antojitos, Hugo venta de ropa, Reyna compra y venta de fierro viejo, Leticia venta de tacos y Castor servicio de albañileria
texts.en:
Brenda is 30 years old.  She is single and only has a high school education.  She says that three years ago she decided to start her own business to earn a little more money so that she could contribute toward her household expenses.  She started selling shoes through catalogs to her friends and neighbors, and gradually gained more customers.  She even goes out to sell in neighboring communities.  Brenda takes orders for her products.  She goes out in the afternoons to show her catalogs to her customers who choose what they like the most and, when she has several orders, she supplies and delivers them.  Brenda is happy because this business has not only given her the opportunity to earn money but has also allowed her to meet people and make new friends.  She will invest this loan in buying a range of shoes and catalogs so that she can continue making her sales.  Brenda hopes that this investment will increase her profits and, in the future, she would like to be able to set herself up in business premises where her customers can come to buy their shoes.

Brenda is a member of a group called Jardines del Bosque which has seven members.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of the place where they live.  The other members of the group are: Verónica, who sells snacks; Silvestra, who sell snacks; Hugo, who sells clothing; Reyna, who buys and sells scrap metal; Leticia, who sells tacos, and Castor who works as a carpenter.

loans.use: to buy a range of shoes

loans.name: Kidzunu 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Anicet, 47, is married with four children, ages 5 to 12. All of his children are currently attending school. Anicet is representing the Kidzunu 2 (#2) group. He owns a small grocery stand where he sells various food and household products. He has been operating this business for two years. He will use the loan to buy sugar, milk, soap and firewood. His business strategy is to sell as much as he can each day. 
Anicet has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to become an accomplished businessman with several different businesses in Brazzaville.
