This is Norafil, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used buy more products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and with their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norafil dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have her own food stall some day.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 61 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. Eliza is widowed with four children. 

To earn a living, Eliza has a small restaurant business selling foods in the community. Eliza earns about PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, iodized salt, sauce, etc.

Eliza has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Eliza would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, iodized salt, sauce, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 53, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Jerry and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers rugs, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Delia hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more raw materials like thread and cloth needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 65 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children. 

Rosita is engaged in a coconut buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in  purchasing coconuts for her coconut buying business.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing coconuts for her coconut buying business

loans.name: Dúo De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo de Sumpango: este Dúo está conformado por la señora Norma originaria de Sumpango, es soltera y una persona muy trabajadora y responsables todos los día se levantan muy temprano para poder realizar sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería en productos comestibles ya que necesita tener más mercadería para satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
One member of the group Dúo de Sumpango is Norma, originally from Sumpango, who is single and a very hard-working and responsible person. Every day they wake up early to be able to get their activities done. She makes a living selling edible products in a convenience store. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more grocery product merchandise, since she needs to have more merchandise to satisfy her needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery product merchandise

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

Jenalyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed & vitamins for her pigs.

Jenalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cesar Joaquin

texts.es:
Don Cesar, de 56 años de edad de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería y venta de comidas. Este negocio es familiar el atiende la pulpería y su esposa vende comida. Tienen dos hijos mayores de edad.  La ayuda atravez de los financiamiento ha resultado un cambio positivo para su negocio ya que le permite invertir en  mercadería para su negocio y mejorar las ventas se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado y que recibe en el momento más oportuno. 
Él está necesitando el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, carne y pollo. Tanto para surtir su pulpería como para hacer comida para vender.
texts.en:
Cesar is 56 years old and a merchant by trade. He has a small general store and sells food. This is a family business. He runs the general store and his wife sells food. 

They have two adult children. The help through the loan has resulted in a positive change for his business, as it allows him to invest in merchandise and improve sales. 

He feels very grateful for the support provided, which he is receiving at the most opportune time. He needs the loan in order to buy rice, cooking oil, meat and chicken; both for stocking his grocery store and for making food to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Sra.  Teresa tiene 44 años tiene cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 5, 7, 11 y 17 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas  y refrescos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio de la zona jardín del Sur, ofreciendo a su clientela variedad de refrescos como jugos La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla algunas veces con la ayuda de sus hijos quien  le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de refrescos por mayor para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. Teresa es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad y está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Teresa, 44, has four children whose ages are 5, 7, 11 and 17; they are all school age.  She sells soft-drinks and turnovers, an activity she carries out daily in her food stand located at home in the Jardín del Sur zone.  She sells a variety of beverages like juices.  Said activity is her main source of income for her and her family.  Sometimes her children help her with the work in both the preparation and with customer service.  The loan will be used to buy soft-drinks at wholesale in order to have a full stock.  Teresa is a very hardworking woman who has been in this activity for years.  She’s very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Posesionarias Group

texts.es: Las posesionarias nos un grupo solidario conformado por 6 mujeres trabajadoras, nombrado así por su primer asesora, tiene 6 ciclos con el crédito y todas habitan en el municipio regiomontano. Myriam es la líder del grupo, una mujer de 30 años, casada y con 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad (ambos son estudiantes). Su esposo se dedica a impermeabilizar casas y Myriam lo quiso ayudar con los gastos familiares. Primero la invitaron a vender joyería y como a ella le gustan las ventas acepto, después comenzó a vender colchas y otros artículos y también puso un snak fuera de su casa. El crédito lo utilizara para resurtir el snak y comprar artículos para bebe como: carriolas, porta bebes, y demás. Myriam desea conseguir un local para vender su mercancía de manera mas cómoda tanto para ella como para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las posesionarias is a solidary group composed of 6 working women, which was named by its first advisor. It has six loans and all of them live in the Regiomontano municipality. 

Myriam is the group's leader. She is a 30-year-old woman, who is married with two children that are 10 and 8 years old (both students). Her husband waterproofs houses and Myriam wanted to help him with the family expenses. She was first invited to sell jewelry, and because she likes sales, she accepted. Then, she started to sell quilts and other items, and started a snack kiosk outside her house. 

She will use the loan to resupply the snack kiosk and to buy baby items, such as strollers, carriers and more. Myriam would like to acquire an establishment so she can sell her merchandise more comfortably, both for her and for her customers.

loans.use: to resupply the snack kiosk and buy baby items.

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en:
Thuc was born in 1980. She has two children, who are studying at primary school. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. Thuc raises ducks to earn a living. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are thus about 5,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy more duck to breed, raise and sell. She wants her children to go to school till university.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to breed, raise and sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a married woman with one child. Cheryl is 33 years old and resides at Pangabuan, Tangub City. She owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month from this business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Cheryl been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Cheryl wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offerings in her general store.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 39 years old, married to Susan and blessed with three children, ages 9, 7 and 5 years old, respectively. He sells shoes and clothes, a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has requested his second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase shoes and clothes to sell. The profit made will help him repay his loan.

He dreams of owning a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 6, 9, 15 años de edad, solamente ella trabaja para mantener a su hogar ya que es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y administra una tienda en un centro escolar, ofrece productos comestibles como boquitas, galletas, dulces, bombones, desde hace siete años administra este negocio y sus hijos le ayudan.

Ella se comprara productos de la canasta básica para preparar alimentos para los estudiantes por ejemplo plátanos, yuca, carne, tomates, condimentos, aceite, entre otros productos que le pueden ayudar para mantener el negocio, este préstamo será un gran aporte para el fortalecimiento del negocio aumentando sus ganancias.

Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar la situación económica de su familia dándole a sus hijos una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, has three children who are 6, 9 and 15 years of age.  She’s the only one who works to support her home since she’s a single mother.  She lives with her parents and manages a store at a school that sells food items like snacks, cookies, candy, bonbons; she’s been in business seven years and her children help her.

She will buy basic staple items like bananas, manioc, meat, tomatoes, condiments and oil, among others that will help her stay in business and to prepare the food for the students.  This loan will be a great support to strengthen her business and increase profits.  Her wish is to strengthen her business to improve her family’s economic situation providing a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, manioc, meat, tomatoes, condiments and oil.
